Don Pedro con el apoyo de este préstamo el  pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento que necesita para su negocio al igual que sus compañeras de grupo.
Don Pedro su sueño es mejorar su casa y tener mas puestos donde vender sus frutas y sus productos.
Al igual que sus compañeros que se dedican a la venta de ropa dos de ellas, la señora CRISTY Y DOÑA INGRIS. 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
Pedro is 40 years old, and has three children. He lives in his own house with his family, and makes a living selling fruits, vegetables and general store items. His wife also helps him run the store. Pedro is the leader of a solidarity group called, "La Coyotera," which is located in the tourist zone of "Jicaro Galán," in the south of Honduras. Pedro is known for being a hardworking person who always seeks to excel and get ahead as an entrepreneur and businessman of the future.

Pedro is requesting a loan in the amount of 13,000 lempiras, and he plans to use this support to purchase fruit, such as: cantaloupe, watermelon, papayas, bananas, oranges, mangoes, as well as general store items, including detergent, bleach, corn and other staple food grains, sausage, and other products. He hopes that this investment and loan will help strengthen his business, as well as the businesses of his fellow group members.

Some day, Pedro dreams of improving his house and opening up additional locations for selling his produce and products. His fellow group members, Cristy and Ingris, make a living selling clothing.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon, cantaloupe, papayas, bananas, oranges, mangoes and miscellaneous items including detergent, bleach, corn and other staple food grains, sausages, etc for his business.

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es:
Don Pablo es una persona muy trabajadora actualmente vive con su esposa la que lo apoya en todo las tareas que el realiza. El y su familia Viven en su casa de habitación en el departamento de Choluteca al sur de Honduras. El se dedica a su negocio propio de compra y venta de ganado.
Don Pablo el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de vacas para su negocio. Don Pablo espera que al finalizar el esta época de invierno su negocio mejore ya que en la temperada el negocio sube. También Don Pablo espera seguir trabajando duro para que así pueda aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Don Pablo en el futuro espera que sus ingresos le ayuden a mejoras a su vivienda y así vivir más cómodo y digno.
Choluteca, Honduras - Agosto del 2012
texts.en:
Don Pablo is a very hardworking person.  He lives with his wife, who supports him in all the work that he does.  He and his family live in their own house in the district of Choluteca in the south of Honduras.  He is in the business of buying and selling cattle.

He needs a loan in order to buy livestock for his business. He hopes that business will improve at the end of this winter, since business increases in the spring.  He also hopes to continue to work hard so that he will be able to increase his sales and improve his quality of life.  In the future, he hopes that his income will help him to make improvements to his home so that he can live with more comfort and greater dignity.

loans.use: to buy cattle for his business.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 32 years old and married with 3 children, ages 5 and 14 years. She sells general stock items in Torkpoi town, Southern area, in Bo, Sierra Leone. She was a student at the Vocational Institute for the Poor. After graduation there were no jobs, so she started this business to raise income to support her family. 

She's been in this business for 10 years and sells wood, food containers and rubber buckets at her store. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to invest in her business.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more variety of items like wood, food container and rubber bucket. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve the living standard of her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business to a higher level. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more variety of items like wood, food containers and rubber buckets.

loans.name: Se's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Se is 53 years old. She has five children, two of whom are dependent and still in school. To support the family, she has been in rice farming on five hectares of farmland for five years and complements the income by selling cakes while her husband works as a paid worker. Having been in this business for 10 years, she and her husband are able to earn about 27,000KHR and manage to save about 10,000KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her business.

Se has been with VisionFund for one cycle while the other members are just with VisionFund this cycle as well. Her past loans have helped her relieve family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group of four members to ask for a loan. Se will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes her crop yield will become more productive so as to earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticide for her farmland.

loans.name: Mil Soles Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Mil Soles” está conformado por 19 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa, repostería, artesanía, gasfitería, trabajo en piedra laja, adornos para el hogar, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Osorno.
Lorena integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el tercer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste un chaquetón de color verde oscuro, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y largo, lo usa tomado y luce unos aros de perla.
Ella se dedica al rubro de artes manuales, realizando encintados y partes de matrimonio, desde hace 2 años. Comenta  que trabaja en su casa de lunes a domingo y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en la ciudad de Santiago, en diferentes distribuidoras y locales donde encuentra articulos para realizar los partes de matrimonio a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará goma eva, papeles especiales para realizar todo lo que es tarjetería.
Las metas de su negocio es crecer y agregar a los eventos más decoración y arreglos florales, y seguir con las ventas de los partes matrimoniales, tarjetas de cumpleaños y lo que su clientela le pida para eventos especiales.
Lorena vive junto a su esposo y 4 hijos de 20, 10, 8 y 3 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel familiar tener su casa propia y darle lo mejor a sus hijos, una buena calidad de vida y estudios para que el dia de mañana sean grandes profesionales.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Osorno es una ciudad que se ubica en la zona sur de Chile, región de Los Lagos. Es un importante centro agropecuario que se identifica como "La Patria de la Leche y Tierra de la Carne" de Chile. Dentro de su actividad agropecuaria se destaca el cultivo de trigo y avena, la crianza de ganado, para el procesamiento de carnes y lácteos además de la fabricación de equipos agrarios.
Destaca en Osorno el único estadio de fútbol techado de Chile, el Estadio Municipal "Rubén Marcos”.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Mil Soles” (“Thousand Suns”). It is made up of 19 entrepreneurs who do various kinds of work, among which are selling clothing, making pastries, artisan work, plumbing services, slab work, decorations for the home, and services, among others. All of them are from the city of Osorno.

Lorena, a member of the communal bank, is standing in the first row in the photo, third from the left. She is wearing a dark green jacket, her hair is long, dark brown, and styled, and she is wearing some pearl earrings.

She works in handcrafts and has made ribbon adornments and wedding invitations for 2 years. She says that she works in her house every day and her schedule is distributed according to her availability.

She buys the merchandise and supplies she needs in the city of Santiago at different distributors and stores where she finds items for making the wedding invitations at a low cost and therefore at an economic advantage.

With the loan, she will buy foam and special paper to make all kinds of cards.

The goals for the business are to grow, to add more decorations and flower arrangements to the events, and to continue selling wedding invitations, birthday cards, and whatever her customers order for special events.

Lorena lives with her husband and four children, aged 3, 8, 10, and 20, who are students. Her dreams at the family level are to have her own house and to give her children the best, a good quality of life and education so that tomorrow they will be great professionals.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity given by Fondo Esperanza, since it will let her invest in her business. With respect to the communal bank of which she is part, she says that in it there is very good communication. On the other hand, the trainings have helped them to learn new sales and accounting strategies.

Osorno is a city located in the southern part of Chile in the Los Lagos region. It is an important farming center, identified as “The Country of Milk and Land of Meat” of Chile. Notable among its farming activities are wheat and oat cultivation and raising cattle for meat and milk processing, as well as farm equipment production. Osorno has the distinction of having the only indoor soccer stadium in Chile, the Rubén Marcos Municipal Stadium.

loans.use: to buy foam and special paper to make all kinds of cards

loans.name: Progreso Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Progreso” está conformado por 16 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de huevos, tejidos, venta de queques, artesanía, taller mecánico, venta de ropa, modista, venta de pantalones de buzos, ferretería, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Jessica integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un chaleco de color gris, encima lleva una chaqueta de color negra, blue jeans, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de mujer y niño, desde hace 6 años. Comenta que trabaja en su casa de lunes a sábado, lo realiza a domicilio y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en la ciudad de Santiago en diferentes distribuidoras y negocios donde encuentra la ropa a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará ropa de mujer y niño de diferentes modelos para la temporada de verano.
Una de las metas de Jessica es tener un negocio con su  mama, ya que es modista y realizar ellas las prendas de vestir para su clientela, así con esto generar mayores ingresos para la familia.
Jessica vive junto a su marido y 3 hijos de 11, 10 y 8 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es darle un buen pasar a sus hijos y un buen futuro escolar, y a nivel personal hacer un curso de confección para trabajar junto a su madre.
Ella está muy agradecida y contenta de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This communal bank, called "Progreso," is made up of 16 entrepreneurs who work in different areas.  These include: weaving, dressmaking, handicrafts, a mechanic's shop, hardware sales, clothing sales, the sale of food items such as eggs and bakery goods, and other services. All of the members live in the city of Valparaíso. 

Jessica is a member of this communal bank.  In the photo, she is seated in the front row in the second seat from the right.  She is wearing a gray vest underneath a black jacket, and blue jeans.  Her hair is dark brown and she wears her hair loose. She has had a business selling women's and children's clothing for 6 years.  She comments that she works from her house from Mondays through Saturdays.  She makes her sales in the house, and then distributes her products on a schedule depending upon her availability.  

She buys her merchandise in the city of Santiago from various wholesalers and businesses where she can find clothing at a low cost, which is thus financially advantageous.  With this loan, she will buy different styles of clothing for women and children for the summer season. 

One of Jessica's goals is to have a business with her mother, because her mother is a dressmaker who could make garments for her customers.  This way, they could generate more income for the family.  

Jessica lives with her husband and 3 children aged 11, 10 and 8 years, who are in school.  At the family level, her dreams are to give her children a good life and a good education, and at the personal level she dreams of taking a class in dressmaking so that she could work with her mother.  

Jessica is very grateful and pleased with this opportunity that is being provided by the Fondo Esperanza, because it will allow her to invest in her business.  She comments that the training has been essential for her business, and also for her personal growth, because she has learned how to better organize and allocate her income and investments.  

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers northwest of Santiago.  It is the capital of the region, and also the headquarters of legislative power in the country.  It was the first port in the nation, and it offers a variety of beautiful and picturesque places, such as the house of the poet Pablo Neruda, winner of the Nobel Prize.

loans.use: to buy different styles of clothing for women and children for the summer season

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana tiene 19 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo. Ella se dedica a vender verduras en su comunidad. Se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. para irse al mercado a comprar la verdura, luego regresa a su comunidad para revenderla ahí.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una plancha para elaborar pupusas y tortillas en su casa. Con el préstamo pretende mejorar su calidad de vida y estabilidad económica ya que vive muy humildemente en una casa de láminas. Ana espera tener éxito en la nueva actividad que realizara. Para construir una casa de bloque o de ladrillo para vivir más segura junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 19 years old. She lives with her life partner and her son. She sells vegetables in her community. She wakes up at 5:00 a.m. to go to the market to buy vegetables. Then she returns to her community to resell them there.

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy a grill to make pupusas and tortillas in her house. With the loan, she is trying to improve her quality of life and economic stability, since she lives very humbly in a house made out of corrugated metal. Ana hopes to have success in the new work she will do in order to build a cinderblock or brick house to live more securely with her family.

loans.use: to buy a grill to make pupusas and tortillas in her house

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani lives in Ashotavan village with her husband, Aram, and her 1-year-old son, Alex. The couple started running a farm a few months ago. Currently Ani and her husband breed chickens, cultivate wheat and barley and grow fruit trees. 

Ani is requesting this loan to purchase seeds for autumn sowing. She also plans to use part of the loan to purchase fuel for the tractor and to hire workers to help with the sowing, reaping and the transportation of the harvest.

"I was involved in agriculture when I was younger in my father's farm. Now I've founded my own farm, and I want to expand it by purchasing livestock. This will allow me to make cheese, butter, from the sales of which I will earn more income and continue the expansion of the farm", says Aram, Ani's husband. 

The stable development of farming is important for this young couple to reach these goals.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fuel and to pay for services of sowing, reaping and the transportation of harvest.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a single mother of four children. Three of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for electricity bills. 

Aisha makes cassava, Irish pancakes and potato chips at the market and has been in this business for 7 years. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

Aisha has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy cooking oil, sugar, flour and sweet bananas.  She is hoping to become a wholesaler and also to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, flour and sweet bananas

loans.name: Ndiang Montagne Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe existe depuis le 15 décembre 2008 il est constitué de vingt femmes qui sont amies, parentes, voisines et ont comme lien commun le commerce.

L'emprunteur vedette madame Coumba est âgée de 52 ans, elle est mariée (3éme épouse) mère de six enfants dont deux filles ;le plus jeune a 18 ans, une de des filles est mariée. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce d'articles de sculpture et divers et capitalise une bonne expérience de plus de 20 ans. Sur la photo, elle est debout à droite à l'extrême habillée en grand boubou vert et a levé la main droite.


Coumba se rend à la capitale et dans les marchés hebdomadaires environnants pour y acheter les mortiers,calebasses, encens et les revendre au marché central de Louga.

Son prêt lui servira à acheter des mortiers pour 75000 F, calebasses 75000 F, encens 15000 F; pour gagner beaucoup de revenus.


Elle participe un peu aux dépenses familiales; elle épargne avec les bénéfices, cotise à une tontine et rembourse son prêt avec.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 15, 2008, and it consists of 20 women who are related, friends and/or neighbors. They all work in trade.  

The featured borrower is Mrs. Coumba, age 52. She is married (3rd wife) and the mother of six children, two of whom are girls. The youngest child is 18 years old. One of her daughters is married. 

Mrs. Coumba sells sculptures and various other items, and she boasts over 20 years of experience in this activity. She is the lady standing at the far right in the photo with her hand raised and wearing a long green dress.

Mrs. Coumba visits the capital and the local weekly markets to buy mortars, gourds, and incense to sell at the central market of Louga.

She will use her loan to buy 75,000 F worth of mortars, 75,000 F worth of gourds, and 15,000 F worth of incense; the sale of these items will help to boost her revenue. 

She helps a little with the family’s expenses. She uses her profits to bolster her savings, to contribute to a savings group, and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy mortars, gourds, incense for resale.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is married and has four children, which all go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents). 

Racheal operates a retail shop and has been in this business for four years. She works seven days a week. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy cartons of salt, bags of sugar and boxes of soap. Racheal works at the market and sells her products to all types of people, but in a retail capacity. Her major business challenges include seasonality, availability of electricity and thieves.

She aspires of becoming a wholesaler and also of building rental houses. She resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and paying for electricity bills.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of soap, bags of sugar and cartons of salt

loans.name: Hezekiah

texts.en: Hezekiah is a father of three children, two of whom are still in school. He has five years' farming experience, with  milk, maize, beans, tea and bananas being his main products, generating income that helps him to meet his family obligations. He also sells timber and hardware for additional income. Hezekiah has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to further expand into horticultural farming.He will buy horticultural seeds and pesticides for his farm especially tomatoes plantation. He will use the income to meet his family's needs. He also aims to expand his dairy farming. He says pests and diseases have been a major challenge with farming, especially with cereals.

loans.use: to expand his horticultural farm.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is training grounds for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has 2 children and has been doing this work for 6 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'She loves Dairy keeping  because it's a sure business!' Her biggest challenge is 'Getting feeds can be a bit hectic.' The animal on the farm has been given the name of 'Lelgina.'

Sarah was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'heard from other existing groups.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: 'She learnt about the various products in Juhudi also the importance of credit.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Sarah replied 'She has got an alternative source of income thus will be able to educate her children.'She will use the loan to buy and insure a dairy cow.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. From the following list of assets to choose from: Cow, Poultry, Pig, Bicycle, Motorcycle, Automobile, Tractor and Pump, Sarah owns the following: cow, poultry, pump.

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. For this the borrower is asked which of the following items are in the household: mosquito net, electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV or DVD. Sarah has mosquito net, tv.

Note: By using mobile devices in the field to build this profile, Juhudi Kilimo is making its operations more efficient. This process keeps costs down, reduces paper usage and provides more information!

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Maddi

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 38-year-old Maddi, from Torkpoi town Southern area Bo. She is married, with two children, 7 years and 20 years old. Her children are currently attending school. 

Maddi runs a hawker business; she sells rubber slippers, underwear, and baby clothes.  She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business every day.  She has more to sell on occasion. She walks door to door to sell her goods and show her new products.  At present she is facing transportation difficulties; there is no vehicle within the environment.  Her other source of income comes from a family member. 

Maddi has requested a loan to buy more rubber slippers, underwear, and baby clothes. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and improve her welfare. In the future, she plans to expand her business in large quantity. 

She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more rubber slippers, underwear, and baby clothes

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy was born in 1978. She has three children. The youngest one is in the 3rd grade. The middle one is in the 7th grade. The oldest one is in the 10th grade. Her husband is a welder. Thuy raises pigs for a living and earns 3,000,000 VND per month. The total earnings of her family are about 7,500,000 VND per month. She has taken part in the credit program of SEDA since 2011. Last cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to enlarge her farm of pigs. Then, she hopes her business can bring in enough money to pay for her children’ education fees.

loans.use: to enlarge her farm of pigs.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raúl tiene 23 años, su pareja es Hortensia, de 20 años, fruto de esa unión tienen un hijo de 4 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia, una que sus padres le dieron por herencia.
Él se dedica a cultivar café y hojas de coca desde hace 4 años. Normalmente trabaja solo, pero en tiempos de cosecha contrata jornaleros para que le ayuden. Sus productos los comercializa en los centros de acopio de su comunidad, donde le ofrecen los mejores precios. Por otro lado, el traslado de sus productos es la tarea más difícil debido a lo pesado de los sacos. Su mayor anhelo es comprar un terreno agrícola para seguir cultivando café, para ello acude a MFP.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que este dinero le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo, y agradece a su banco  comunal por darle la confianza y permitirle trabajar junto al resto de los socios.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles que solicita aumentará el monto que tiene ahorrado para comprar una hectárea más de terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
Raúl is 23 years old and he and his wife of 20 years have four children.  They live together in a home of their own which they inherited from one of their parents.  He has been raising coffee and coca leaves for four years.  He normally works on his own, but he hires field hands to work during the harvest.  He sells his products in the supply centers within his community, where they offer him better prices.  The other side of that is that transporting his products is the most difficult part, given the weight of the sacks.  His greatest desire is to buy some farmland so that he can continue raising coffee.  It’s for this reason that he has approached MFP.

This will be his third loan through MFP and he knows that this money will greatly help with the progress of his work.  He is grateful to his communal bank for trusting in him and permitting him to work alongside the other members.  The 1,000 PEN he is requesting will increase the amount of money he has saved up and he will use it to buy a hectare of farmland.

loans.use: to buy farmland

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio tiene 55 años, está casado con Simeona, de 52 años, con quien tiene cuatro hijos. La casa donde viven es propia, la logró comprar gracias a su trabajo.
En 10 años, él ha logrado que su tienda de comestibles crezca poco a poco, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de su esposa, quien se encarga de las ventas cuando Sergio viaja a traer mercadería de la ciudad que se ubica a 8 horas. Para él, su negocio es rentable, ya que tiene ingresos diarios. 

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, está orgulloso de contar con este apoyo, por la confianza que ponen en su trabajo. Promete ser puntual, como en el anterior crédito, y no hacer quedar mal a su banco comunal. 
Con estos 1,000 nuevos soles comprará conservas, verduras, cereales y demás productos para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Sergio is 55 years old and is married to 52 year old Simeona.  They have four children together and have their own home, which they managed to buy, thanks to his hard work.

In 10 years he has successfully grown his grocery store little by little with his wife’s help.  She takes care of sales whenever Sergio travels to pick up merchandise in town, located eight hours away.  For him, his business is profitable and he has a daily income.

This will be his second loan through MFP and he is proud to be able to count on this support and for the trust that they place in his work.  He promises to be on time with his payments, as with his previous loan, so that he will not be in bad light with his communal bank.

He will use the 1,000 PEN to buy preserves, vegetables, cereals, and other products to stock his store.

loans.use: to stock his store

loans.name: Virgen De Copacabana Group

texts.es:
La socia Mary Luz tiene 40 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella es natural de la provincia de La Convención del departamento del Cusco pero vive en la provincia de Urubamba. La socia Mary Luz es una madre emprendedora y responsable que le gusta los retos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Urubamba donde expende sus ricos platos de comida. Desde hace varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Mary Luz requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, papas, verduras, aceite, sacos de azúcar, fideos y otras más. (La socia Mary Luz está levantando la mano en la fotografía).

Este grupo está conformado por vecinos y amigos que formaron el banco comunal “Virgen de Copacabana” en la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está  conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Algunos de los socios se dedican; venta de comida, venta de comestibles, venta de materiales de construcción y otros brindan servicio de enfermería y servicio de transportes. Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, por sus centros arqueológicos, por su centro histórico, por sus paisajes, por su historia y por ser una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido también por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Mary Luz, 40, is in a common law relationship and has two children.  She’s originally from La Convención Province in Cusco Department but now lives in Urubamba Province.  Mary Luz is an enterprising, responsible mother who likes challenges.  She sells food in one of the city markets in Urubamba; she prepares delicious meals.  She’s been in this business for several years and does very well.  On this occasion, Mary Luz needs the loan to buy ingredients like sacks of rice, potatoes, vegetables, oil, sacks of sugar, noodles and others.  (Mary is raising her hand in the photo).

The members of this group are neighbors and friends who joined together in the “Virgen de Copacabana” communal bank in Urubamba Province, Cusco Department.  This communal bank contains people who are always seeking ways to get ahead and by means of their own efforts provide their children with a better future.  Some of the members’ lines of work are: food sales, grocery sales, building materials sales and some of them provide nursing services and transportation services.  The members as a group are grateful for the support provided and commit to make their various installment payments as scheduled.

Cusco is located in Cusco District and Province which are in Cusco Department in the very heart of the ancient Inca city.  It’s noted for being a tourist destination because of its archaeological sites, its historic city center, its scenery, its history and for being an enchanting city in the southern region of the country.  Cusco is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, potatoes, vegetables, oil, sacks of sugar, noodles and others.

loans.name: Sumac Maky Group

texts.es:
La socia Nely tiene 49 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos, ella es natural de la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. La socia Nely es una madre emprendedora y responsable que le gusta los retos, ella se dedica a la venta de artesanía, ella tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio donde elabora tejidos en base de lana de alpaca. Desde hace varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Nely requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo lana de alpaca. (La socia Nely está levantando la mano en la fotografía).

Este grupo está conformado por vecinos y amigos que formaron el banco comunal “Sumac Maky” en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está  conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, por sus centros arqueológicos, por su centro histórico, por sus paisajes, por su historia y por ser una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido también por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Nely, 49, is married and has three children.  She’s from Cusco Province in Cusco Department.  Nely is an enterprising, responsible mother who likes challenges.  She sells crafts.  She has a small workshop at home where she makes weavings based on alpaca wool.  She’s been in this business for several years and does very well.  On this occasion, Nely needs the loan to buy work supplies like alpaca wool, for example.  (Nely is raising her hand in the photo.)

This group is composed of friends and neighbors who joined together into the “Sumac Maky” communal bank in Cusco Province, Cusco Department.  The bank is composed of people who are always seeking ways to get ahead and by means of their daily efforts provide a better future for their children.  The members as a group are grateful for the opportunity provided and commit to make their installment payments as scheduled.

Cusco is located in Cusco District and Province which are in Cusco Department in the very heart of the ancient Inca city.  It’s noted for being a tourist destination because of its archaeological sites, its historic city center, its scenery, its history and for being an enchanting city in the southern region of the country.  Cusco is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy work supplies like alpaca wool.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina lives in the Murang'a area of Kenya, which is situated near Nairobi. She has 2 children and has been doing this work (farming) for 14 years. Her primary income sources are milk, crops, job salary and personal business. She will use the loan to buy a water tank to harvest water for her farming activities.

She stated what is most enjoyable to her about farming. She enjoys livestock farming as well as crop farming, especially growing maize and beans! What is her biggest challenge? 'Keeping many dairy cows is because of feeding.' The animal on the farm is named 'Kairu meaning black.'

Angelina was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied that Juhudi is offering loans for farming and she needs a water tank to enable her to do irrigation farming. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Micro-finance helps to eradicate poverty.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Angeline replied that she will generate more income which she will channel to educating her children.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Angelina owns the following: 'cow, poultry, pump' but does not own 'pig, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, running water, TV, DVD' but does NOT have 'solar power, sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy a water tank to harvest water for her farming activities.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a 29-year-old married woman. She has six children, ranging from 6 years to 17 years. She describes herself to be faithful and trustworthy. 

She operates a food stall where she sells food. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a clean water shortage, which is used by her family for drinking and her business for cooking.  She will use the KES 8,500 loan to buy a water dispenser for her eight family members to use for drinking clean water. 

Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. This is her second loan from SMEP DTM. She also has a farm that increases her business income.

loans.use: to buy a water dispenser for clean water.

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 26,250 pesos Arsenio podrá comprar arroz, azúcar, habichuelas,  fideos y productos enlatados para abastecer su tienda de comestibles. Arsenio opera dos negocios a la vez, es el peluquero de su comunidad y hace poco tiempo inició su tienda de comestibles. Arsenio es casado y su esposa se dedica al cuidado de la casa y sus niños que tienen 4 años y 9 meses. Este año el de 4 años iniciará en el preescolar.
 
Como Arsenio sabe que los ingresos de la peluquería no son suficientes para sostener el hogar y enviar a su niña a la escuela, decidió iniciar este nuevo negocio, pues su deseo es ser un hombre que pueda asegurar la manutención de su hogar y el estudio de sus niñas.
texts.en:
With a loan of 26,250 pesos Arsenio will be able to buy rice, sugar, beans, noodles and canned products to supply his food store. He runs two businesses at once: he is the neighborhood hairdresser and opened his food store a short while ago. 

Arsenio is married and his wife looks after the house and his children, who are 4 years and 9 months old. This year his 4-year-old child will start pre-school. As Arsenio knows that the income from his hair salon is insufficient to support his household and send his daughter to school, he decided to invest in this new business. He hopes to be a man who can ensure that his household is provided for and his children can go to school.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, beans, noodles and canned products to supply his food store.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 14,840 pesos Susana podrá comprar medicamentos para su negocio de venta de medicamentos genéricos a bajo costo en su comunidad.
Susana tuvo la idea de iniciar este negocio al ver que en su comunidad no había farmacia y los habitantes de la misma tenían que viajar hasta la próxima comunidad más cercana con farmacia.

Susana es casada, su esposo es maestro constructor. Juntos tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad que ya se han casado y le han dado 8 hermosos nietos, que son su gran orgullo.

Susana tiene 57 años, su deseo es fortalecer su negocio para poder construir su casa, pues sabe que tanto a ella como a su esposo ya no le quedan muchos años para poder hacer ese sueño una realidad. `Quiero una casa grande, donde todos mis nietos puedan venir a jugar y a comer los fines de semana` dice Susana.
texts.en:
With a loan of 14,870 Pesos, Susana will buy medicines to sell in her business of generic medicines at a low price in her community. Susana had the idea to start this business after realizing that her community did not have a pharmacy, which led people to travel to a neighbouring community with a pharmacy.

Susana is married and her husband is a master builder. Together, they have 4 adult sons and daughters who are married and have given them 8 beautiful grandchildren, which are their greatest pride.

Susana is 57 years old. She wishes to strengthen her business to build a house, since she knows that both her husband and her don't have enough years left to make that dream a reality. "I want a big house, where all of my grandchildren can come to play and eat during the weekend", says Susana.

loans.use: to buy over the counter medicines for her business in generic medicine sales.

loans.name: Jenneh

texts.en:
Jenneh is 45 years old and married with three children, ages 14 years to 25 years. Two of her children are currently attending school.  

She runs a palm oil stand at her house, in Torkpoi town Southern area in Bo in Sierra Leone. Her husband is elderly; he cannot earn any income to bring into the home. She also earns income from her daughter. 


She’s been in this business for 20 years, and she sells palm oil, gari, and beans. She says the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to run her business.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more bags of pepper and a gallon of palm oil. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her living and increase her business.  

In the future, she would like to open a palm oil store. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of pepper and a gallon of palm oil.

loans.name: Nduluve

texts.en:
Nduluve, 54, lives in the coastal region of Kenya. She lives in her own house with her husband. In order to support the household, she has had a business selling milk for 3 years. 

Nduluve is requesting a loan to buy more milk for sale. With this investment, she will increase her income. Through this loan she will be able to have more milk available to sell, and so her business will improve.

Nduluve aspires to develop as a businesswoman and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more milk for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
La señora Olga de 41 años de edad, es madre soltera vive con sus tres hijos y dos nietos, ella renta donde vive ya que no tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace 20 años al negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas su negocio esta ubicado en un barrio de Nacaome, Valle al sur de Honduras y su venta es en su casa de habitación y sus clientes le prefieren por su atención y buen servicio a sus clientes.
Doña Olga esta solicitando 5,000.00 lempiras para compra de maíz, leña y cal. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para su negocio y seguir adelante con su proyecto de  terminar de construir su casa que es su sueño ya casi hecho realidad, con las utilidades generadas por el préstamo ella desea suplir otras necesidades de ella y su familia.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
Olga, 41, is a single mother living with her three children and two grandchildren.  She rents her house because she does not own a house of her own.  For the last twenty years she’s been working making and selling tortillas.  Her business is located in a neighborhood in Nacaome, Valle in south Honduras and she sells from home.  Her customers prefer her because of her kind, good customer service.

Olga is asking for a 5000 Lempira loan to buy corn, lime powder and firewood.  With support from this loan she intends to cover the financial need her business has and continue with her project of completing building her house since that dream is about to become a reality.  With profits generated from the loan she wants to meet some other needs she and her family have.

San Lorenzo, Honduras-August, 2012.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder and firewood.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima, 23, is single and rents her dwelling place. She sells clothes, an occupation she learned from her mother when she was a little girl. To buy merchandise, Halima travels to the city because she believes she gets better prices there.

The loan she’s requesting from Yehu is to buy more merchandise to stock her business and meet customer demand because the number of her customers has increased. She hopes to open a boutique in future. Some of the things she would like to buy with loan include clothes of different types to offer a variety of her customers to chose.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes for sale

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité KUÑA GUAPA, es de la ciudad Ypané actualmente están en el tercer ciclo. Con los créditos que acceden ellas invierten en sus despensas, ventas de artículos varios (trabajo de costurería, compras y ventas de ropas nuevas y usadas).
En la compañía de Rosado Guazu, casi un 89% de la población se dedican al cultivo y plantación de Verduras y frutas (berenjena, lechugas, tomate, zanahorias, cebollitas, repollo, naranjas, mandarina, melón, sandías entre otros)
El crecimiento que han tenido en sus negocios, les ha ayudado para poder ir incrementando sus actividades comerciales y poder mejorar la calidad de vida. Como por ejemplo con algunas ganancias muchas de las señoras han re modelado sus viviendas, y sus respectivos negocios.
La sra. Mirna, una de las integrantes del grupo se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, con esta actividad ella genera ingresos para su familia y aporta a la canasta familiar. Desea tener un negocio mas surtido para poder ofrecer a su clientela mayor variedad de frutas y verduras.
Solicita el crédito para comprar frutas y verduras y luego revenderlas
texts.en:
The “Kuña Guapa” committee is from the city of Ypané and is currently in its third cycle.  With the loans they are able to invest in their grocery stores, in their various other sales businesses, in new and used clothes sales and in providing sewing services.

In the Rosado Guazu Compañia nearly 89% of the population works growing fruit and vegetables (eggplant, lettuce, tomatoes, carrots, onions, cabbage, oranges, mandarins, melons and watermelons, among others).  The growth their business have had has helped them to gradually increase their commercial activities to improve their quality of life.  For example, some of the women were able to use part of their profits to make physical improvements to their homes and their respective businesses.

Mirna is one of the group members.  She sells fruit and vegetables.  She generates income this way for her family and contributes to their basic needs.  She wants to have a better-stocked business to offer her customers more variety of fruit and vegetables.  She’s asking for the loan to buy fruit and vegetables to resell.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a fish seller at Teshie. She is a 58-year-old widow with 2 adult, independent children. At a younger age, she discovered she was talented at selling, so she started helping her mother with fish-selling. 
She has been with ID Ghana since 2010, and this is her third loan. She is from Teshie, and has been living there since she was born. She needs a loan of 250 Ghana cedis to buy more fish for the business.
Elizabeth thanks Kiva for the willingness to help her.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
Doña Herminia es una persona muy trabajadora dedicada a su negocio, vive con su esposo y sus hijas. En el departamento de Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Ella tiene más de 10 años de tener este negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas.
Doña Herminia el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, leña y cal. De esta manera incrementara más sus ventas. Con el préstamo espera incrementar sus ventas y atender mejor a sus clientes para tener mejores ingresos.
Doña Herminia sus sueños es poder terminar de pagar su vivienda y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija y una buena educación.
Choluteca, Honduras - Agosto del 2012
texts.en:
Herminia is a very hardworking person who is dedicated to her business.  She lives with her husband and their daughters in the district of Choluteca in the south of Honduras.  She has had a business making and selling tortillas for over ten years.

She will use the loan proceeds to buy corn, lime and firewood for her business.  This will enable her to increase her sales.  With this loan she hopes to be able to provide enhanced service to her customers and thus increase her income.

Her dream is to be able to pay off her house and provide her daughters with a better quality of life and a good education.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos, tiene la edad  de 36 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y cinco  hijos de los cuales unos están en colegio y otros le ayudan en las labores del campo. El con el crédito pretende comprar  insumos como abonos y fumigaciones para asistir el café  y además comprar una bomba de espalda para fumigar el café. El tiene pensado comprar  estos insumos y la bomba para mantener el café en excelente estado  y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, 36, is married living with his wife and five children; some of his children are in school and some of them help him with the work in the fields.  He intends to use the loan to buy some supplies like manure and fumigation to care for the coffee and will also buy a fumigation pump that’s worn on the back to fumigate his coffee.  He plans to buy these supplies and the pump in order to keep his coffee in excellent condition so that he can generate higher profits and attain a better quality of life and economic stability.  

This is the first loan he’s gotten from Fudecosur.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks but Fudecosur gave him the best loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies and work tools.

loans.name: Nallely Guadalupe

texts.es: La Srta. Nallely de 19 años de edad es soltera y no tiene dependientes económicos. Ella esta trabajando en una maquiladora de la localidad vive con su mama y siempre la ha ayudado a solventar los gastos que se presentan en su casa. Es una señorita muy trabajadora y no le gusta dejar las cosas a medias, siempre se esfuerza por conseguir ese extra para poder brindarle lo mejor a su mama. En esta ocasión esta solicitando de nuestra ayuda para reparar el techo de su casa ya que sabe que es muy importante tenerlo bien construido ya que es su protección en dias lluviosos. Agradecerá la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en: Nallely, 19, is single and has no economic dependents.  She’s employed at a local assembly plant and lives with her mother; she’s always helped to cover household expenses.  She is a very hardworking young woman who does not like to do things halfway; she always strives to do that little ‘extra’ to provide her mother with the very best.  On this occasion she’s asking for help to repair the roof at home because she knows that it’s important to have it well-built since it’s their protection when it rains.  She will be grateful for whatever help she can get.

loans.use: to repair the roof at home.

loans.name: Jenny Rocio

texts.es:
Jenny hace 10 años atrás comenzó con la ayuda de su padre un pequeño negocio de venta de cosméticos. Día a día sola con esfuerzo y dedicación fueron incrementando sus ventas,  en las cuales ella vendía perfumes, cremas, desodorantes etc. 
En la actualidad ella sigue con su negocio en donde comercializa perfumes, cremas, desodorantes y otros artículos que les piden sus clientes. Tiene  muchas aspiraciones para su vida y negocio ya que tienen un hijo que aun está en la escuela, por esa razón quiere en los próximos años terminar de construir su casa y sigues creciendo en ventas con los productos que vende. Pero por ahora ella quiere variar su mercadería para poder diversificar sus clientes comprando con el préstamo perfumes para hombres y mujeres, cremas, jabones, aretes etc.
texts.en: Ten years ago, Jenny started a small business selling cosmetics with help from her father.  Day to day thanks to her efforts and dedication sales increased gradually; she sold perfume, creams, deodorants, etc.  She is still in the business of selling perfume, creams, deodorants and other products her customers request.  She has many hopes for her life and for her business because she has a son who is still in school and this is why she wants to finish her house in the next few years and continue increasing her sales.  For now, though, she wants to vary her merchandise in order to diversify for her customers.  She will buy perfume for men and women, creams, soaps, earrings, etc.

loans.use: to buy perfume and creams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and coffee seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a fumigation pump.

loans.name: Roy

texts.es: Roy, tiene la edad  de 29 años, está casado,  vive con la esposa   y un  hijo. El con el crédito pretende comprar un novillo de engorde, el cuenta ya con dos en su poder y quiere reforzar el negocio.  El tiene pensado comprar este novillo para darle la alimentación adecuada y poder venderlos en el mercado local  y  con ello crecer en el negocio y  obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Roy, 29, is married living with his wife and son.  He intends to use the loan to buy a calf to raise.  He already has two and wants to strengthen the business.  He’s thinking about buying the calf to feed adequately and then sell in the local market and thus make the business grow and obtain a better quality of life and economic stability.  This is the first loan he’s gotten from Fudecosur.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur gave him the best loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Hokie

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 42-year-old Hokie from Torkpoi town, Southern area in Bo. She is married with five children between the ages of 15 years and 25 years.  Two of her children attend school. She began her business because she needs to raise income to support her family.

Hokie runs a wood store at her house; she sells wood, palm oil, and gari (cassava flakes). She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business every day, even on holidays, because her customer base has improved. Her other source of income comes from small-scale farming. She describes her major problems as the high cost of transporting the wood from the forest to the town, and poverty in their home.    

Hokie has requested a loan in order to buy more wood, palm oil, and gari. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her family welfare and change her business to a provision shop. In the future, she plans to open a provision shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more wood, palm oil, and gari.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, tiene la edad  de 62  años, está soltero,  vive con el padre  y  unos hermanos. El con el crédito pretende comprar almacigo de café para su posterior siembra en una propiedad que se encuentra baldía, El tiene pensado comprar este almacigo para sembrarlo y con el mismo dinero asistirlo y poder producir dentro de un tiempo y con ello  obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Carmen, 62, is single living with his father and some siblings.  He intends to use the loan to buy coffee seedlings to plant later on land that’s currently fallow.  He plans to buy the seedlings to plant them and with the same money care for the crop so that it will be productive shortly and with this he will obtain a better quality of life and economic stability.

This is the first loan he’s gotten from Fudecosur.  He’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur gave him the best loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy seedlings.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.es: Teresa, tiene la edad  de 52 años, está casada,  vive con el esposo   y tres  hijos. Ella  con el crédito pretende comprar una vaca de leche, ella cuenta ya con dos en su poder y quiere reforzar el negocio.  Ella  tiene pensado comprar esta vaca para aumentar los productos como la natilla y leche y queso para su posterior venta en el mercado local y lugares aledaños  y  con ello crecer en el negocio y  obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Teresa, 52, is married living with her husband and three children.  She intends to use the loan to buy a dairy cow.  She already owns two and wants to strengthen the business.  She plans to buy the cow to increase production of such things as custard, milk and cheese to then sell in the local market and in surrounding places thus increasing business and attaining better quality of life and economic stability.


This is the first loan she’s gotten from Fudecosur.  She’s had no previous loans with state banks and Fudecosur gave her the best loan terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Juntos Podemos Group

texts.es:
La socia Jesusa tiene 44 años de edad y  es casada y fruto de esta hermosa tiene cuatro hijos, ella es natural de la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco y vive en la misma provincia donde nació. La socia Jesusa es una madre emprendedora y responsable que le gusta los retos, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y expende sus productos en uno de los mercados más populares de la ciudad de Cusco. Desde hace varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Jesusa requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo papa, cebolla, zanahoria, tomates, lechuga, perejil, habas, cebollita china y otras más. (La socia Jesusa está levantando la mano en la fotografía).

Este grupo está conformado por vecinos y amigos que formaron el banco comunal “Juntos Podemos” en la provincia de Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está  conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, por sus centros arqueológicos, por su centro histórico, por sus paisajes, por su historia y por ser una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido también por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Jesusa is 44 years old and is married.  She and her husband have four children.  She is a native of the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco and lives in the same province where she was born.  (She is raising her hand in the photograph.)

She is an enterprising and responsible mother who enjoys challenges.  She has a business selling vegetables in one of the most popular markets in the city of Cusco.  She has had this business for several years, and things are going very well.  Currently she needs a loan so that she can buy merchandise such as potatoes, onions, carrots, tomatoes, lettuce, parsley, beans, green onions and more.

This group is comprised of friends and neighbors who formed the communal bank “Juntos Podemos” ("Together We Can") in the province of Cusco in the department of Cusco.  The communal bank is comprised of people who are at all times looking for opportunities to get ahead, and to work each day to bring a better future to their children.  All of the members are grateful for this loan opportunity and promise to complete their individual loan repayments according to the agreed-upon schedule.

The city of Cusco is located in the district and province of Cusco in the department of Cusco, and it is in the heart the ancient city of the Incas.  It is known for its tourist attractions, its archaeological centers, its historic city center, its countryside and its history.  It is also one of the enchanting cities of the southern region of the country.  Additionally, it is known for its traditional festival Inti Raymi and for having one of the seven wonders of the world -- Machupicchu.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as potatoes, onions, carrots, tomatoes, lettuce, parsley, beans, green onions and more.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Lucinda from the Torkpoi Town Southern area in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 13 years and 25 years of age. Two of her children are going to school. 

Lucinda runs a hawker clothing business in her community; she sells jeans, wax cotton, and shirts. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business from 8:00AM until 7:30PM, 6 days per week. On Sunday she goes to church. Her husband is a driver. She also receives income from him to support the home. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to invest in her business.

Lucinda has requested a loan in order to buy more jeans, wax cotton, and shirts.  The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her loan installments and expand her business. In the future, she plans to open a big clothing store. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more jeans, wax cotton, and shirts.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 31 años de edad, es una mujer soltera y no tiene hijos, ella reside en el Barrio  Palmira, Gualaco, Olancho. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotería en general, inicio su negocio hace dos años el cual lo logro con  mucho esfuerzo, trabaja de forma individual y la pulpería la abre desde las 7:00 am y cierra a las 6:00 pm de lunes a domingo. Con el      apoyo de este préstamo ella podrá comprar productos como ser: arroz, azúcar, manteca, refrescos, churros, dulces, vegetales, entre otros. Con la ayuda de este préstamo la pulpería de Elena cambiara porque tendrá mas surtido y así atenderá mejor a los clientes. Los desafíos que enfrenta son el alto costo de la vida y la falta de empleo para generar ingresos. Su sueño para el negocio es hacerlo mas grande y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Es el primer ciclo que solicita Elena en FAMA y espera cancelar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en: Elena is 31 years old, she is single and has no children. She lives in Barrio Palmira, Gulaco, Olancho. She sells groceries, an activity she succeeded in starting two years ago with great effort. She works alone Mondays to Sundays, opening her store at 7 am and closing it at 6 pm. Thanks to the loan she is requesting she will be able to buy products such as rice, sugar, butter, soft drinks, churros (long fritters made with flour and water), sweets, vegetables and many more. Thanks to this loan Elena’s store will change because she will have a better supplied inventory and will consequently be able to serve her customers better. The challenges she has to face are the high cost of life and the lack of jobs to generate income. She dreams to enlarge her store and to provide a better service to her customers. This is the first cycle Elena is working with FAMA and she hopes to punctually repay her dues.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, butter, soft drinks, churros, sweets and vegetables for her general store.

location.town: San Francisco de la Paz, Olancho

loans.name: Maribely De Jesus

texts.es:
Maribely tiene una venta de helados y jugos en un kiosco del parque principal de su municipio, y gracias a este ahora puede generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Debido a que hace mucho tiempo que tiene su negocio, Maribely ha logrado captar muy buenos clientes, y con su esfuerzo ha venido superando poco a poco las dificultades de capital que presenta en el negocio. En su hogar, su negocio le ha permitido brindar una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos, y es por esto que siempre busca seguir aumentando sus ventas para que sus hijos puedan acceder en un futuro a una educación universitaria. Buscando atender la demanda de sus clientes, Maribely busca un préstamo para comprar una granizadora y surtir su negocio con productos que se han ido agotando.

Su sueño es poder tener un negocio más grande donde pueda generar más empleo, pues ahora puede generar un empleo para una persona que es madre soltera cabeza de hogar, pero aspira a poder generar aún más empleo.
texts.en:
Maribely sells ice-cream and juice at a kiosk in the main park in her municipality.  Thanks to this she is now able to generate the income needed to cover the household expenses.  This is because she has had her business for a long time.  Maribely has managed to win over very good customers.  Through her effort she has been, little by little, overcoming the capital difficulties in her business.  

In her home, her business has allowed her to give her children a better quality of life.  That is why she is always looking to continue increasing her sales so that her children will be able to access a university education in the future.  

She is looking to tend to her customers’ demand.  Maribely is looking for a loan to buy a slush machine and to stock her business with products that have been depleted.

Her dream is to be able to have a bigger business where she would be able to generate more jobs.  Now she is able to generate one job for a single mother who is the head of her household.  However, she aspires to be able to generate even more jobs.

loans.use: to buy a slush machine and to stock her business with products that have been depleted.

loans.name: Macmillan

texts.en:
Macmillan lives in the Malindi area of the Central Province, Kenya. He is married with six children. He owns a dairy farm, a business he has been operating for ten years. Besides this, he is works for another employer.
He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group. Macmillan joined with the goal of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges is the lack of farming equipment and water.
Macmillan is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenyan shillings to buy another dairy cow. His extra income will add to his savings to improve the living standards of his family and pay school fees for his children. He aspires to expand his business and buy dairy cows and more land for farming.

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food and tools for her cafe.

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary lives in the Changamwe area of the Coast Province, Kenya. He is married with two children, one of whom attends school. He has owned a retail shop for three years.
He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group. Hillary joined with the goal of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are competition and a lack of funds.
Hillary is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and cereals wholesale. His extra income will add to his savings to improve the living standards of his family. He aspires to expand his business by opening a wholesale store.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and cereals wholesale.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: This is 31-year-old Frank. He is married with two children, aged six and four, who are both in school. In 2009, Frank established his drinks business. He began his business to become more self-reliant. This is his only source of income. Working seven days a week and 17 hours a day, he earns about Le 470,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Frank has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy soft drinks, Star beer, stout, batteries, and root powder. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 280,000. In the future, Frank plans to educate his children, to build his own house and to buy a commercial bike. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: This is 39-year-old Sarah. She is married and has three children, aged 17, 14, and 11. They are all in school. In 2006, Sarah established her business making and selling textiles, ladies' bags and traveling boxes. She began her business because she wants to provide for the basic needs of her children and herself. This is her only source of income. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 580,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Sarah requires a loan in order to buy lace, Baramokor, wax cotton and easy wear textiles. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 280,000. In the future, Sarah plans to develop her plot of land, educate her children and seek more funds for the expansion of her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy lace, Baramokor, wax cotton and easy wear textiles.

loans.name: Virgen Natividad De Huayllabamba Group

texts.es:
La socia Erika 32 años de edad y  es madre y padre para sus dos hijos, ella es natural de la Provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. La socia Erika es una madre emprendedora y responsable que le gusta los retos, ella se dedica a la venta y compra de pasto al por mayor y también vende en uno de los mercados más populares de la ciudad de Urubamba. Desde hace varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Erika requiere el préstamo para comprar pasto. El sueño de la socia Erika es que sus hijos se han profesionales. (La socia Erika está levantando la mano en la fotografía).

Este grupo está conformado por vecinos y amigos que formaron el banco comunal “Virgen de Natividad de Huayllabamba” en la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está  conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; crianza de animales menores, venta de pasto, venta de choclo y venta de verduras. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, por sus centros arqueológicos, por su centro histórico, por sus paisajes, por su historia y por ser una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido también por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Erika, 32 years old, is a single mother of two children. She is from the Urubamba province in the Cusco region. Erika is an enterprising and responsible mother who likes a challenge. She buys and sells wholesale livestock feed for a living and currently sells in one of the most popular markets in Uruamba. For several years, she has worked in this business and it is going very well. On this occasion, Erika needs a loan to buy livestock feed. Erika's dream is that her children will become professionals. In the photograph, Erika is raising her hand.

This group is comprised of friends and neighbors who form the Virgen de Natividad de Huayllamamba communal bank in the Urubamba province in the Cusco region. This communal bank includes individuals who look for opportunities at all times in order to move forward in their daily effort to provide their children with a better future. Some examples of the members' economic activities are raising small livestock, selling livestock feed, selling sweet corn, and selling vegetables.

In general, the members are grateful for the opportunity given to them and they promise to make the payments on their loans by the due dates.

The city of Cusco is located in the district and province of Cusco in the Cusco region. Cusco is in the heart of the ancient Incan city and is characterized as a tourist area due to its archeological centers, its historical center, its scenery, its history and for being an enchanting city in the southern region of the country. Cusco is also known for Inti Raymi, its traditional festival, and because it is the home to one of the seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in the Changamwe area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married with six children, three of whom are in school. Mary rents out hand carts to the residents of her neighborhood. This business has been in operation for two years.
She learned about Milango through a friend, and has a goal of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her business challenge is debts from customers who do not pay.
Mary is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy more hand carts. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her living standards and enable her to pay for personal items. Her plan for the future plan is to have a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy more hand carts.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has one child. She owns a clothing business which she has been operating for one year.
She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. Emelda joined Milango with the goal of accessing credit to improve her business. Her main challenges are high fuel and transportation costs, price fluctuations, inflation and taxes. 
Emelda is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of second-hand clothes. Her extra income from the loan will increase her savings. Her dream is to open other clothing businesses in other areas.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married with five children. She owns a water business which she has been operating for six years. She provides water to her neighbourhood.
Fatuma learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined with the goal of accessing credit to improve her business. Her main challenges are seasonal weather, price fluctuation, inflation and finding customers. 
Fatuma is applying for a loan of 43,150 Kenya shillings to buy another water pump. Her extra income from the loan will help pay the school fees for her children. Her dream is to buy a transportation vehicle and build a residential house.

loans.use: To buy another water pump.

loans.name: Kambizi

texts.en:
Kambizi lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has five grown children. For eight years, she has owned a farm where she sells goats. She also sells sisal. This business enables her to be less dependent on her children and to be able to provide for her own needs.
She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined with the goal of accessing credit to improve her business. 
Kambizi is applying for a loan of 22,000 Kenya shillings to purchase new stocks of sisal and goats. The extra income from the loan will help her to grow the business.

loans.use: To purchase a new stock of sisal and goats.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a resident of the Kilifi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is single with one child. She has owned a cosmetics shop for five years. She also works for another employer.
Selina learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group. She joined with the goal of accessing credit to improve her business. Her main challenge is competition.
Selina is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy shampoo and hair oil. The extra income from the loan help her to improve the living standards of her family. She hopes to open a wholesale cosmetics shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy shampoo and hair oil.

loans.name: Elcy Del Socorro

texts.es:
Elcy se encuentra casada, tiene 2 hijos, y debido a que las condiciones económicas en su hogar se estaban deteriorando cada vez más, ha decidido montar su propio negocio de venta de helados aprovechando que en el sector no se encuentra un negocio de estos. Fue con unos ahorros que inició su negocio en el cual tiene experiencia de haber trabajado durante muchos años anteriormente, y debido al poco capital con el que fue montado, solo ha comprado los recursos necesarios y está ubicado en la sala de su casa. A pesar del poco capital con el que fue montado, gracias a la buena atención que ofrece, su negocio ha salido adelante y ahora cuenta con muy buenos clientes que le permiten generar ingresos con los que su familia tiene mejores condiciones económicas. Buscando poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así poder aumentar sus ventas, Elcy busca un préstamo para realizar adecuaciones locativas en su negocio y poder separar la sala de su casa del negocio.
