Patricia, es comerciante se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad; pero necesita ampliar su tienda  es por ello que ha solicitado un préstamo  que será destinado para la compra de mercadería tales como: azúcar, aceite, sal, cal, frijoles, arroz, bebidas,detergentes etc.

Ella revela que el crédito anterior le dio un efecto muy importante, aumentaron sus ingresos, se elevo el nivel de clientela y  expandió la gama de productos, y esto la ha llevado a estar en una posición económica más  favorable y un nivel de vida  superior.
texts.en:
Patricia is a merchant. She sells basic necessity products but she needs to expand her store. That is why she has asked for a loan which will be used to buy merchandise such as: sugar, oil, lime, beans, rice, beverages. detergent, etc.

She says that the previous loan had an important effect on her. Her income increased, her income went up, she had a higher number of customers, and she had more products. This has taken her to a more favorable financial position and a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, salt, lime, beans, rice, beverages and detergents.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase the security in her home

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban es un productor desde hace muchos años junto con su esposa Julia, su hijo y sus cuatro hijas se dedican a realizar esta actividad. Por lo regular es el propio Esteban junto con su hijo quienes se encargan de las labores más pesadas en la finca y su esposa e hijas se encargan de las labores del hogar y de un vivero en el que producen planta de café para sus fincas y para vender a otros productores de la región. Durante la temporada de cosecha toda la familia se va a trabajar a la finca para cortar café pues es demasiado el trabajo que hay que realizar. Esteban acaba de sembrar hace poco nueva planta de café ya que algunas de las que tenía ya han cumplido su ciclo de vida productivo. Para que estas plantas crezcan como debe ser es necesario que esteban les aplique fertilizante y por eso está solicitando un crédito el cual pagará al final de la cosecha. Durante las temporadas que no hay mucho trabajo en la finca familiar Esteban trabaja para otras personas en el campo y su hijo trabaja en una cristalería. Pasando la cosecha a Esteban le gustaría poder apoyar a su hijo para que ponga su propio negocio de cristales y aluminios.
texts.en: Esteban has been a farmer for many years. Together with his wife, Juila, their son, and their four daughters, he does this activity. Normally Esteban himself and his son do the heaviest work on the farm and his wife and daughters do the housework and work in a nursery where they produce the coffee plants for their farm and to sell to other area farmers. During the harvesting season, the whole family goes to work at the farm because there is too much work to do. Esteban just put in some new coffee plants, since some of the ones he had already finished their productive life cyle. For these plants to grow the way they should, it is necessary for Esteban to apply fertilizer to them and that is why he is asking for this loan. He will pay for it at then end of the harvest. During the times when there isn't a lot of work to do on the family farm, Esteban works for other people in the field and his son works for a glass company. When the harvest is over, Esteban would like to be able to support his son so he can open his own glass and aluminum business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee plants.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José Luis es agricultor desde hace más de treinta años, su principal actividad es la producción de café orgánico. Él está casado con Alicia con quien tiene tres hijos y dos hijas. Junto con su familia trabajan en el campo y entre todos se encargan del negocio del café, cada uno realizando distintas actividades. Durante la pasada cosecha José Luis produjo un total de seis toneladas de café las cuales entregó en su totalidad a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” para que fueran procesadas y exportadas. Para la siguiente cosecha José Luis necesita realizar algunas actividades en su finca como comprar planta, resembrar, hacer labores de limpieza y fertilizar con productos orgánicos. Si lleva a cabo todas estas labores en un lapso de dos años estará cosechando un total de ocho toneladas de café, lo cual mejorará sus ingresos. Para realizar estas actividades solicita un crédito el cual pagará al final de la cosecha. Además de producir café José Luis también se dedica a la producción de caña y de hoja de plátano. La hoja de plátano la tiene sembrada en sus cafetales y esta le ayuda a darle sombra a sus plantas de café. José Luis nos cuenta que durante muchos años ha trabajado con la ayuda de créditos y es así como ha podido poco a poco ir aumentando su patrimonio.
texts.en:
José Luis has been a farmer for more than thirty years. His main activity is the production of organic coffee. He is married to Alicia with whom he has three sons and two daughters. He works alongside his family in the fields and between them all they look after the coffee business, each one of them carrying out different jobs. 

During the last harvest, José Luis produced a total of six tons of coffee, which he gave in its entirety to the “Unión Regional de Huatusco” [a Fair Trade-certified coffee cooperative] so that they could be processed and exported. For the next harvest José Luis needs to carry out some jobs on his farm such as purchasing plants, re-sowing and doing some cleaning and fertilizing jobs with organic products. If he does all this work in the space of two years he will grow a total of eight tons of coffee, which will improve his income. 

In order to carry out these jobs he is requesting a loan which he will repay at the end of the harvest. Apart from producing coffee José Luis also produces sugar cane and banana leaves. He has the banana leaves sown in his coffee plantations and this helps to shade the coffee plants. José Luis tells us that he has worked with the help of loans for many years and this is how he has gradually managed to increase his wealth.

loans.use: to purchase coffee plants, re-sow, fertilize and clean his plantations.

loans.name: Clarance

texts.en:
Clarance lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She has four children. She owns a green grocer stall from where she sells tomatoes. She learnt about Milango through friends, who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is high transport and fuel prices.

Clarance is applying for a loan of 104,750 Kenya shillings to buy tomatoes in wholesale. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand her business. Her dream is to own a bigger grocery and supply to others.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes in wholesale.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen lives in Kongowea, Kenya. She is single and has an eight-year-old child who has begun schooling. Doreen runs a retail shop, which has been operating for six years. She employs three other people in her business. Besides this business, Doreen also earns some income from her formal employment.

Doreen was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for her second loan of 53,800 Kenya shillings to purchase milk. The business also faces the challenge of overall inflation, which has reduced the purchasing power of most customers. Her dream is to open up other business branches in future.

loans.use: to purchase milk for sale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel lives in the Changamwe area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has three children. He owns a store house business, which he has been operating for a twenty years. In this store, he provides logistical support to his clients. He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are theft and untrustworthy staff. 

Daniel is applying for a loan of 104,800 Kenya shillings to buy a business van. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve on his living standard. His dream is to operate a fully registered carriage service.

loans.use: to buy a business van.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is a 56-years-old merchant from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. He has five adult children and  has run a sari-sari, or convenience store, for more than ten years now. This is the source of his income. Cesar works hard to earn a living for the needs of the family. 

Cesar joined CEVI some time ago to gain access to the financial and other services offered by the organization. He is requesting  a loan worth 9000PHP to buy more stock to sell in his store such as canned goods, noodles, snack foods and other items. With this loan, Cesar will be able to attract and cater to more customers to buy from his store, thus augmenting his sales and income.

In the future, Cesar wants to expand his current business so that it will continue to generate more revenue which is necessary for the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy stocks to sell in his store such as canned goods, noodles, snack foods and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Lilian Arely

texts.es: Lilian tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo, su esposo trabaja en un taller de pintura de casas en Estados Unidos. Ella desde hace siete años tiene una sala de belleza el cual el oficio lo aprendió en una academia, trabaja ella sola y su horario de atención inicia de las 8:00 am y culmina a las 5:00 pm, una de sus desventajas es que el local donde esta ubicada la sala de belleza es muy pequeño. Lilian solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos y comprara una secadora de pelo. Con el apoyo de este préstamo podrá hacer mas grande su negocio y mantenerlo surtido para así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. El sueño de Lilian es hacer más amplio su negocio y tener su propio local. Es el primer préstamo que solicita en FAMA y con la ayuda del crédito se motiva para seguir trabajando.
texts.en: Lilian is 27 years old, married, and has one child.  Her husband works as a house painter in the United States.  Lilian has been running a beauty salon for seven years, having learned the trade at a beauty school.  She works alone, starting at 8.00am and finishing at 5.00pm.  One of the problems she has is that her premises are very small.  Lilian is requesting this loan to invest in buying cosmetics and a hair dryer.  With the support of this loan, she will be able to expand her business and keep it stocked so that she can meet her customers' needs.  Lilian's dream is to expand her business and own her own premises.  This is the first loan she has requested from FAMA and the help from this loan motivates her to continue working.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and a hair dryer

loans.name: Amparo Alexandra

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida por su cultura tradicional, por la alegría de su gente  y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del banco comunal  Las Piedras.

En este lugar vive la señora Amparo, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 5 años el  mismo que estudia en escuela. El marido se dedica a la cría de animales.
 
Ella junto al esposo se dedican a la cría de pollos para lo cual cuentan con dos galpones, en los cuales cada quince días meten hasta 200 pollos para criarlos, cuando están listos  los entregan a comerciantes los mismos que llevan los pollos a venderlos en distintos mercados de la ciudad, el esposo lleva más de 8 años con este negocio, lo cual  les da lo suficiente para salir adelante.

Está repitiendo el crédito ya que con el anterior le fue muy bien y con las ganancias que le dejo su negocio ella aumento una parte de un galpón con el cual ahora ya puede meter más pollos para obtener más ganancias. Ella va a utilizar te crédito para comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para los mismos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro o un camión.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of Las Piedras community bank meet in a neighborhood called Las Piedras, in Picoaza parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  Portoviejo is known for the cheerful nature of its people and its San Pedro and San Pablo celebrations.

This is where Amparo lives.  She is 26 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  The couple have a 5-year-old son who is in school.  Her husband raises livestock.

Amparo and her husband both raise chickens and they have two chicken sheds for this purpose.  Every two weeks they put up to 200 chicks in the sheds to raise.  When they are ready, they deliver them to traders who take them and sell them in different markets in the city.  Amparo's husband has been in this business for more than eight years and they make enough money to get by.

Amparo is requesting a new loan because she did very well with her last one.  She was able to use the profits she made from her business to increase the size of her chicken shed so that she can put more birds in it and make even more profits.  Amparo will use this loan to buy chicks.  She will also buy feed and medicines for them.  Amparo has been a member of her community bank since it was founded and she likes it because of the help and benefits that she receives.

Amparo's dream is to own a car or a truck.

loans.use: to buy chicks, feed and medicine

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is 44 years old and married with three adult children. She is from the town of Baligatan, province of Isabela Isabela. For the past 15 years, she has been selling fish at the market. She earns approximately 4,200 PHP a month. To have additional income, Carmelita is requesting a loan of PHP 23,000 to buy additional fish for her store in order to gain more customers. She wishes that she can give all the needs of her family, most especially she hopes she can sustain the needs of her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase fish for her store.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is from Gango Rizal, Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old. Gina is married and has one child. To make a living, she makes and sells food. She has been engaged in her business for 13 years and earns about 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2009, she joined GDMPC. Gina is requesting a new loan of 4,500 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: MARIA ES UNA MUJER DE 52 AÑOS, ES UNA MUJER VIUDA DESDE HACE 11 AÑOS, VIVE EN SU CASA QUE LE DEJO SU ESPOSO Y LA ACOMPAÑA SU HIJA QUE AUN ESTA SOLTERA. MARIA RECIBE LA PENSION DE SU ESPOSO MENSUALMENTE Y COMPARTE LOS GASTOS CON SU HIJA YA QUE VIVEN LAS DOS SOLAS EN SU CASA. SU HIJA TRABAJA EN UNA FABRICA Y MARIA SE DEDICA AL HOGAR Y TAMBIEN A CUIDAR DE SUS NIETOS YA QUE TIENE 2 HIJAS QUE YA ESTAN CASADAS Y LA VISITAN EN SU CASA. DESDE HACE UN TIEMPO MARIA EMPEZO A OBSERVAR LA NECESIDAD DE ARREGLAR EL EXTERIOR DE SU CASA, YA QUE SU HOGAR ES EL PATRIMONIO QUE LE DEJO SU ESPOSO Y DEL CUAL ELLA QUIERE MANTENER EN PERFECTAS CONDICIONES PARA SU FAMILIA. CON ESTE DESEO A SOLICITADO UN PRESTAMOS PARA REALIZAR LA COMPRA DE LA PINTURA NECESARIA PARA ARREGLAR SU CASA, ASI COMO DE MATERIAL PARA ARREGLAR ALGUNOS DETALLES DE LA FACHADA DE SU DOMICILIO.
texts.en:
Maria is a 52 year-old woman who has been a widow for the past 11 years. She lives in the house left her by her husband, along with her daughter, who is still single. Maria receives her husband’s monthly pension and shares expenses with her daughter, since only the two of them live in her house. Her daughter works in a factory and Maria dedicates herself to her home and also cares for her grandchildren since she has two married daughters who visit her at home.

Awhile ago, Maria began to observe the need to upgrade the exterior of her house since her home is a legacy from her husband and she wants to keep it in perfect condition for the family. With this goal in mind, she has requested a loan to purchase the paint needed to fix-up her house, as well as supplies to make some repairs on the exterior.

loans.use: to upgrade and paint the exterior of her house.

loans.name: Las Palomas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Palomas está integrado por 7 personas alegres, amigables y trabajadoras cada una de ellas desarrolla una actividad económica: Perfecta venta de pollo, Raquel venta de ropa, María Isabel venta de cosmeticos, Cipriana Gabriela venta de comida y servicio de costura, Ángela venta de calzado, Celsa venta de lenceria Y José Luis venta de lencería. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una region cañera, la gente se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de caña de azucar.

Doña Perfecta platica que sus padres solo le dieron estudios hasta secundaria y después le enseñaron a trabajar para ganarse la vida y salir adelante. Ella es madre soltera de dos hijos y ha tenido que trabajar duro como comerciante para sacarlos adelante, ella actualmente realiza ventas de pollo destazado y queso en el corredor de su casa saca una mesa, su bascula y sus productos como ya tiene varios años vendiendo no tiene que salir a ofrecer sus clientes llegan a buscarla para hacerle el gasto (comprar), también nos platica que en su tiempo libre elabora bolsas tejidas y blusas las cuales vende posteriormente y gana un poco de dinero extra. Lo que mas le gusta a Doña Perfecta de su actividad es que la puede realizar sin desatender a su hijos y de paso los va enseñando a trabajar ya que le ayudan a despachar algunas veces. Ella invertirá este crédito en la compra de pollos y queso para continuar realizando sus ventas. Ella desea a futuro poder continuar con la construcción de su casa y darle mas estudios a sus hijos.

Este grupo agradece a la fundación por el apoyo que les da con este crédito.
texts.en:
The Las Palomas group has seven cheerful, friendly and hard-working members, each of whom has their own business activity.  Perfecta sells chicken, Raquel sells clothing, Maria Isabel sells cosmetics, Cipriana Gabriela sells food and provides a dressmaking service, Angela sells footwear, and Celsa and Jose Luis sell underwear.  The group is located in a region where people grow sugarcane.

Perfecta tells us that her parents only sent her to school up to high school level and then taught her to work so that she could earn a living and provide for herself.  She is the single mother of two children and has had to work hard as a saleswoman in order to provide for them.  She currently sells chicken (in pieces) and cheese.  She places her scales and her products on a table in front of her house.  As she has been selling for a number of years, she doesn't have to go out to make her sales as her customers come to her.  She also tells us that in her free time she weaves bags and blouses which she then sells to make a little extra money.  What Perfecta likes most about her business is that she can take care of it without neglecting her children.  At the same time, she is able to teach her children to work as they sometimes help her to serve her customers.  Perfecta will invest this loan in buying chickens and cheese so that she can continue making her sales.  In the future, she would like to continue building her house and ensure her children further their studies.

This group is grateful to Fundación Realidad for the support that they are providing through this loan.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like rice, frozen foods and drinks.

loans.name: Bintang Lima Group

texts.en:
Khotimah is 38 years old and married with four children who go to school. She has been running her food business for about ten years now. She sells fried duck. Her business sometimes does not run well, because at unexpected moments security police come and tell them to move by force because they do not have permission to sell there. 

She will use this loan to buy duck meat and to rent another place so she will not worry anymore about her business if the security police come. Her dream is to have a duck restaurant so that the next time she will not worry about finding customers or about security police.

loans.use: to buy duck meat, rice, oil, gas to cook the food, and to rent a place.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina is 54 years old and married with four grown children. She is a very responsible mother. She sells different vegetables and fruits in their village. She hopes that someday she can build her own stall in front of their house. She is asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy additional vegetables and fruits that she can offer for sale in their village in order to have additional income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy squash, eggplant, onions and garlic for her business.

loans.name: Irene Elalith

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida por su cultura tradicional, por la alegría de su gente  y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del banco comunal  Las Piedras.

En este lugar vive la señora Irene, tiene 42 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, una mayor de edad y el menor de 16 años que estudian en universidad y colegio. El marido trabaja en un bus.
 
Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja todos los días, deja a crédito sus productos  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende es ropa de mujeres.

Está repitiendo el crédito ya que con el anterior le fue muy bien y gracias a las ganancias que le dejo su negocio ella pudo empezar un tratamiento médico ya que está un poco delicada de salud. Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y sobretodo ropa de temporada playera. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta por la ayuda y atención que le brindan en la institución.
 
Su sueño es tener un local para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The Las Piedras community bank meets twice a month in the Picoaza neighborhood of Portaviejo, a city known for its happy people, its traditional culture and its Festival of St. Peter and St. Paul.

Our member, Sra. Irene, 42, lives with her husband.  They have two children, one of whom is grown and in college and the other, 16, in high school.  Her husband works on a bus line.  
 
Sra. Irene operates a clothing sales business and sells all kinds of clothing.  She sells door to door and has a small shop in a space in her house, as well.  She works every day.  She sells on credit and collects from her customers twice a month.  She buys merchandise in Guayaquil once or twice a month, depending on her requirements.  She has operated the business for a year now and says that she is happy with her progress.  

Sra. Irene is applying for a new loan because the last one, she says, was very helpful to her business.  She adds that her busienss earnings covered the costs of much needed medical care.  She will use this loan to stock her business with pants, blouses, shirts and, most importantly, beachware for the coming summer season.  She has been a member of the community bank from the beginning and says that she values the help and attention that it offers its members.
 
For the future, she wants to open her own store.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Soy's Group

texts.en:
A widow living in a rural area located in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Soy is 58 years old and has five children. She has struggled to feed the family through farming rice for almost forty years and complements that income by working as a paid construction worker in a rural area. 

Soy’s group consists of two members who are both females and this is the second microloan for her group with VisionFund. The first loan has helped her relieve her family’s burden. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland and use a portion to spend for labor in plowing her farmland. She hopes to increase her rice harvest and sell it for a good price to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Simorn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Simorn is aged 42 years and married with six children. Three of them are dependents and still in school while the other three have their own employment. She is a rice farmer who has been in this business for fifteen years while her husband is a paid construction worker. The current business earns her about US$5 per day and she manages to save about US$2.50 each day for the future. 

This is the second loan for her group with VisionFund and they both completely paid back the first loan, which has enabled them to make a living better. Now leading her group of two to apply for another loan, Simorn will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farm and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to have a more fruitful rice harvest to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farm

loans.name: Salinas

texts.en:
Accion has just funded a young start-up photographer, Salinas.  Salinas has always loved photography.  Since she was a child she was fascinated by light, texture and landscapes.  Salina first began photographing as a hobby, working for friends and family that wanted her to document important events.  Salinas' hobby quickly turned into a full time business as people began asking for her services in particular to document weddings in and around Seattle.

All of her work to date has been booked by word of mouth.  The biggest difficulty that Salinas has encountered in getting fully up and running has been not having the right equipment that is of the highest quality in order to promote her best products.  Salinas has lacked the capital to purchase in particular a new camera.  Salinas needs a loan from Accion to purchase both the first and second lens of a Nikon professional camera.  These items are expensive and Salinas would rather not put this lofty purchase on her credit card.  Please assist Salinas to purchase a new camera for her business!  Please visit Salinas' work at www.salinasholcomb.com

loans.use: to purchase a Nikon lens and filter

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a 51-year-old woman who is married with two children. Her husband is a farmer who also runs a transport business in which he drives a van. Veronica wants to help her husband repair and paint the van, but she doesn't have enough money. So she has applied for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). When Veronica gets the loan, she will be able to help her husband improve the condition of the van. He will then be able to work extra hours to increase the family's income, which in turn will improve their living conditions. Veronica is a very loving mother and wife; she does everything for her family.

loans.use: To buy paint and tires, and to pay for the maintenance of her van

loans.name: María Rossana

texts.es:
En un sector conocido como Las Piedras de la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida por su cultura tradicional, por la alegría de su gente  y sus fiestas de san Pedro y San pablo, se reúnen cada quince días las socias del banco comunal  Las Piedras.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 12, 7 y 3 años de edad, los  dos mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo y productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja tres días a la semana de dos a tres horas al dia y sobre todo en las mañanas cuando sus hijos están en la escuela, ella solo  le tiene que llevar al más pequeño ya que no tiene con quien dejarlo pero esto no le impide realizar sus recorridos, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Está repitiendo el crédito ya que con el crédito anterior le fue muy bien y gracias a las ganancias que le dejo su negocio pudo comprar ciertas cosas que necesitaban sus hijos para sus estudios, y como uno de sus hijos enfermo tuvo que ocupar sus ganancias en medicina y médicos, pero está contenta ya que gracias a esto su hijo ha mejorado rápido. Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa por catalogo ya que tiene varios pedidos por entregar. Es fundadora del banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son muy importantes en su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The Las Piedras community bank meets twice a month in the Picoaza neighborhood of Portaviejo, a city known for its happy people, its traditional culture and its Festival of St. Peter and St. Paul.

Our member, Sra. Maria, 33, lives with her husband.  They have three children, 12-, 7- and 3-years old, respectively.  The two oldest children are now in school.  Her husband drives a taxi for a living.  
 
Sra. Maria operates a clothing and cosmetics sales business to help her husband with household expenses and runs the family home.  She stocks her business with products--clothing, Avon and Yanbal cosmetics--that she orders from catalogs and sells them from door to door.  She works two or three hours a day, three days a week.  She works in the mornings mostly because that's when her two oldest children are in school.  She takes her youngest child along on her calls because she doesn't have anyone to leave him (or her) with, but she's never given up.  She sells on credit and collects from her customers every eight days.  She has operated the business for a year and says that she is happy with her progress.

Sra. Maria is applying for a new loan because the last one, she says, was very helpful to her business.  She adds that her business earnings covered the costs of much needed medical care for one of her children and that he (or she) is much better now.  She will use this loan to stock her retail business with clothing, cosmetics, etc.  She started the community bank and says that loans have been very important for her business.
 
For the future, she wants to open her own store.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Familia Toribio Group

texts.es: El grupo “Familia Toribio” se encuentra ubicado en una comunidad muy tranquila donde la gente es muy mable y sociable por lo regular siempre están muy alegres. Las integrantes del grupo son familia solo son tres mujeres nos comentan que nunca habían estado trabajando con una micro financiera  así que es la primera vez estaban un tanto nerviosas después de haber firmado su contrato pero están seguras que no quedaran mal. Magaly quien es la representante del grupo nos platica que tiene 27 años de edad es mama soltera de una niña de un año y seis meses  que no va  a la escuela pero está muy ilusionada con que algún día vaya a la escuela. Magaly tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde vende lo que más le piden “Inicie mi negocio porque trabajaba en la Ciudad de México pero no me gustaba estar tan lejos de mi hija así que para pasar más tiempo con ella decidí poner la tienda hace 4 meses y me gusta mucho ver cómo crece poco a poco lo que menos me gusta es decirle a mis clientes que no tengo lo que me están solicitando es por eso que solicite el crédito para comprar más productos como pan, leche, refrescos, huevo, aguas, azúcar ya que es lo que más que se vende”. La dificultad que tiene por el momento es que tiene a una vecina como competencia ya que tiene muchos años trabajando su tienda y tiene más clientes pero esto no la desanima todo lo contario "quiero hacer más grande mi  negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y así poder sacar adelante a mi hija y darle lo mejor me gustaría que terminara una carrera profesional". Todas están muy agradecidas por la confianza que la institución ha depositado en ellas ya que es muy difícil que les quieran prestar dinero. Gabriela invertirá en su negocio de pollos y tortillería, mientras que María invertirá en la venta de tortillas y tlacoyos.
texts.en:
The Toribio Family lives in a very quiet community where the people are very friendly and sociable and are usually very cheerful. The three members of the group all belong to one family and they have never worked with a microfinance group before. As a result they were a little nervous after having signed their contract, but they are sure that nothing bad will come of it. 

27-year old Magaly is the group’s representative. She is a single mother of a daughter aged 1 year and 6 months who does not yet attend school although she is already excited about the prospect. Magaly runs a small grocery store where she sells goods that are most in demand. “I used to work in Mexico City,” she says, “ but I didn’t like being so far from my daughter so I started the business so I could spend with more time with her.”

She decided to open the store four months ago and she likes seeing how it’s slowly grown. She doesn’t like having to say to her customers that she doesn’t have what they are looking for so she is seeking a loan to buy more products such as bread, milk, soft drinks, eggs, water and sugar. One problem she has at the moment is a neighbour who has run the same kind of store for many years and has many customers. However, this doesn’t put her off--on the contrary. 

“I want to expand my store and earn a bigger income,” Magaly explains. “I want to help my daughter get on in life, give her the best I can. I would like to see her finish university.” 

All members of the group are grateful for the trust shown in them by the institution as it is very difficult for them to borrow money. Gabriela will put the money into her chicken and tortilla-making business, whilst Maria will put her money into her business selling different kinds of tortillas.

loans.use: buy milk, bread, eggs, sugar etc.

loans.name: Radha Krushna-1 Group

texts.en:
In the year 2010, four women from Podapali village of Nuapada district in Odisha, India formed a group named 'Radha Krushna' (named after the Hindu God lord Krishna and His power Radha whom they believe to be their protector) to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their business. Basumati is one of these women. The lady standing on the extreme left in the photo raising her hand is Basumati, aged 26, a very poor tribal lady who lives with her husband and her daughter aged 2. Her family belongs to a Below Poverty Line (BPL) category. People from the BPL category live on less than one dollar a day. The present house where her family is residing has been allotted to her father-in-law under Indira Awas Yojana of govt. of India. (A housing scheme for landless families)

 Basumati has been running a general store in the local market of her small village for the last 8 years. Her husband supplements her in her business. She sells general grocery items like rice, oil, sugar, lentils, biscuits, soft drinks (sodas) and stationery such as books, pens, etc. Basumati was able to increase the variety of items at her general store with her scanty savings and increase her cash flow. Her monthly income from the existing business is Rs.5000/-. 

Out of this income she has been able to manage her household expenses and she spent some income on house repair. As per her statement, she was able to increase the variety of items in her shop but not the inventory. She wants to increase the stock of her business. So the loan amount will be utilized to purchase items like rice, wheat, lentils, oil, etc. for her general store.This will help her to reduce her purchasing and transportation costs as she will replenish her stock less frequently. 

Basumati hopes to save enough for building a good house for her family as the present house is very small and congested. Basumati has a charismatic dream of getting rid of poverty and mingling with the mainstream of her society. The other three members of the group are Jema, Rajanirani and Dillip who are running bakery items vending business, a tailoring center and a grocery shop respectively. 

Since the inception of Radha Krushna group, Basumati has been heading the group with dedication and sincerity. Other members of the group are also very happy and satisfied under the dynamic leadership of Basumati.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing rice, wheat, lentils, oil, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 60-year-old married woman with four grown-up children. At her age, she is still strong enough to fulfill the needs of her family. 

Gloria manages a store in front of her house. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional products such as canned goods, snack foods and drinks for her store. In the future, she hopes that her business will expand to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 49 years old and married with children. She is from the village of Alibagu in the province Isabela. 

Estrella owns and operates a general store, where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. She earns 4,000 PHP a month. 

Estrella is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. In the future, Estrella hopes to expand her store to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spices, drinks, canned goods and snack foods.

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora is from Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. She is 50 years old and widowed. She has three children. 

Nicanora plants, harvests and sells bananas for a living. She's been engaged in her business for seven years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Nicanora joined GDMPC. 

Nicanora is requesting a loan of 9,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 43 years old and married. She is from Calabayan, Ozamis City. She has six children who have helped her take care of their banana-harvesting business. They have been harvesting bananas for 10 years and earn 6,000 PHP a month. 

Recently, Mary Jane joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and to pay for weeding costs. She hopes to have a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to pay for weeding costs.

loans.name: Superacion Group

texts.es: Doña Mirian tiene 48 años de edad, es miembro del Grupo Solidario Superación, es casada y tiene 2 hijos, su esposo se dedica administrar una pulpería. Hace 20 años doña Mirian inicio con una amiga a vender ropa que fue quien le enseño como trabajar en el negocio y luego decidió poner su propio negocio de venta de ropa usada, su horario de atención es de 7:00 am a 5:00 pm, una de sus ventajas es que tiene mucha clientela y la desventaja es que tiene que pagar alquiler de local. El préstamo que doña Mirian solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de fardos de ropa con estilos nuevos y que estén a la moda para poder llamar la atención de sus clientes y así aumentar sus ventas para obtener mayores ingresos que le ayuden al sustento de su familia. Una de sus metas es tener su propio local y que sea amplio para atender mejor a sus clientes. Doña Mirian es el primer préstamo que tiene con FAMA y espera cancelar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Doña Mirian is 48 years old and a member of the Superación Communal Bank. She is married and has two children. Her husband runs a small store. Twenty years ago, Mirian and a friend began selling clothing. The friend taught her how to run the business and Miriam decided to start her own business selling used clothing. Her schedule of work is from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. One of her advantages is that she has a large clientele and a disadvantage is that she has to pay rent on  the shop.

Miriam needs the loan she is requesting to purchase bundles of clothing in new styles that are fashionable in order to attract the attention of her customers and increase her sales so she can earn more income to help support her family.

One of her goals is to own her shop and that it will be a large one to better serve more customers. This is Miriam’s first loan with FAMA and she plans to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothing.

loans.name: El Triunfador Group

texts.es:
Miguel tiene la edad de 23 años, estudios la universidad y es soltero, el platica que hace un poco mas de un año decidió  iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio de venta de carne enchilada ya que le ha sido un poco difícil encontrar un empleo y quería ayudar a su mama con los gastos del hogar. 

El realiza estas ventas una vez a la semana, un día antes sale a ofrecer la carne enchilada y levanta pedidos, al dia siguiente se levanta muy temprano para prepararla y al medio día salir a entregarla a sus clientes, el dijo "se vende bien la carne, aunque a veces se tiene que caminar mucho pero lo importante es que se venda y hacer nuevos clientes para que las ganancias aumenten". El invertirá este crédito en la compra de carne de cerdo y variedad de chiles para continuar realizando sus ventas. Miguel desea a futuro poder tener un negocio estable al cual puedan sus clientes acudir a comprar sus productos.  Miguel es miembro de un grupo llamado El Triunfador el cual esta integra por 4 personas mas Candelaria y María Luisa con venta de antojitos mexicanos, Hilaria venta de refrescos y Luciano servicio de albañileria. Este grupo se ubica en la comunidad de Vicente en una región cañera, en esta comunidad esta el ingenio La Margarita y es principal fuente de empleo.
texts.en:
Miguel is 23 years old, has been to university, and is single. A short while ago he decided to open his own business selling meat sauce since it has a been a little difficult finding work so he could help his mother with household expenses. He sells the product one day a week. The day before he goes out to get orders, and then the following day he gets up very early to prepare the meat. About midday he sets off to deliver the orders to his customers.

“The meat dish sells well,” he says, “although I sometimes have to walk a long way. But the important thing is that I make sales and get new customers so that my income increases.”

Miguel plans to use the loan to buy pork and a variety of chiles so he can continue making the food. In the future he would like to have a permanent place where customers could go to buy his products. He is a member of a group called El Triunfador. There are four other members: Candelaria and María Luisa sells Mexican snacks, Hilaria sells soft drinks, and Luciano is a builder. They all live in Vicente in the Cañera region where the sugar refinery La Margarita is located. It is the major employer in the region.

loans.use: buy chiles and meat

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City. She has earned money through providing transportation services for five years. In this way, she can support the needs of her four children. She earns an income of 5,000 PHP a month from this business. 

For a 34-year old mother, there’s nothing more that can make her happy except to see her children successful in their studies. 

Arlene would like to borrow 9,500 PHP from GDMPC to repair her transport vehicle used in her business. She joined GDMPC in 2008. Her plan in the future is to improve her business.

loans.use: to repair her transport vehicle.

loans.name: Dialo's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 17 femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé  le 11 juillet  2008. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Diola (assise à l’extrême droite dans la photo avec une main levée) est emprunteur vedette du groupe,  âgée de 60 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfant (03 garçon et 02 filles).

Elle s’active dans le maraichage. Elle achète de la semence d’oignon, piment, tomate, ces produits récoltés sont écoulés dans les différents marchés hebdomadaires de la région.  Une  activité qu’elle fait depuis plus de 3ans.
-	Pour une somme de 50 000F Cfa  elle parvient à financer son projet de maraichage.
Elle se retrouve souvent avec un bénéfice net de 30 000F Cfa après déduction de toutes ses charges.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de prendre en charge une partie de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
This is a group of 17 women who are very active members of the local Banc Villageois created on July 11, 2008. They are all from the same village and get along nicely. Their main activity is small trade. 

Mrs. Dialo (sitting at the far right in the photo with her hand raised) is the featured borrower for the group. She is a 60-year-old married mother of five children, three boys and two girls. 

She has been a market gardener for over three years. She buys seeds to grow onions, peppers and tomatoes which she sells at various weekly markets in the area. 

She can finance her market gardening activity with 50,000F Cfa. She often ends up with a net profit of 30,000F Cfa after deducting all her expenses.

The profits earned through this activity will allow her to take over part of the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds to grow vegetables for sale.

loans.name: José Eusebio

texts.es:
Don José Eusebio vive en una comunidad muy tranquila donde la gente acostumbra a trabajar desde muy temprano. Al parecer, la comunidad es muy tranquila, donde la mayoría de las personas saludan en su lengua Mazahua. 

Don Eusebio tiene 64 años de edad, está casado desde hace ya varios años con la señora Felipa, ellos formaron una familia con cuatro hijos de los cuales ya todos se casaron y han formado familia a su vez. Don Eusebio es una persona muy trabajadora, tiene un negocio desde hace varios años, no recuerda exactamente el total de años pero sí recuerda que fue por los años 70 cuando inició a vender cualquier cosa que pudiera. Actualmente vende calcetas, calcetines, mercería, ropa interior para dama y caballero, cuando se le preguntó cómo fue que inicio su negocio dijo: “Porque me dieron unos lugares en los mercados grandes en los municipios entonces tenia que ocuparlos y fue como decidí iniciar mi negocio de mercería, es por eso que solicite un nuevo crédito para invertirle más”. Don Eusebio está muy agradecido con la institución porque desde hace tiempo ha sacado crédito para invertir y su negocio ha crecido mucho es por eso que piensa no quedarle mal a VisionFund.

Cuenta que vende todos los días en sus puestos, solo descansa los días jueves al parecer a Don José Eusebio le gusta mucho atender su negocio ya que burlonamente dijo: “Me gusta atender a mis clientes porque sé que se acordaran de la buena chismorreada que nos dimos y regresaran para seguir platicando, también me gusta porque así puedo pasar más tiempo con mi esposa ya que es ella quien me ayuda” Gracias al crédito Don José Eusebio podrá invertir en su mercancía ya que comenta que se vienen temporadas muy buenas. Por el momento, no tiene ninguna dificultad en su negocio siempre ha tratado de que no le haga falta mercancía para no perder clientes. Cuando le cuestionamos cual era su meta el contesto “Creo que a mi avanzada edad no puedo tener grandes planes pero si me gustaría que mi negocio nunca se vaya abajo para que yo y mi esposa puédanos vivir dignamente y no preocuparnos”. Sin embargo, Don Eusebio está muy agradecido con la institución ya que siempre lo ha apoyado para hacer crecer su negocio y calidad de vida ha mejorado ya que pudo levantar su casa y comprarse una camioneta.
texts.en:
Don José Eusebio lives in a quiet place where the local people are used to starting work early.  They greet each other in Mazahua, the local language.

Don Eusebio, 64, and his wife, Felipa, have been married for many years.  They have four children, all grown now, with families of their own.  Don Eusebio is a hard-working man and has operated his business for many years.  He doesn't remember exactly when he started the business, but says that it must have been sometime in the 1970s.  He sells socks, underwear and other clothing pieces.  When we asked him how he started the business, he said, "I had space in one of the large markets in town and had to fill it with something so I started my business there . . . I will use this loan to stock the business".  Don Eusebio says that he is grateful to the VisionFund for past loans because they have helped him to grow his business.

Don Eusebio works almost every day, only taking Thursdays off.  He likes the work and jokes, "My customers like to gossip about local goings-on and I know they'll come back to pick up where they left off".  He adds, too, that he, "can spend more time with his wife because she helps me with the business".  Don Eusebio will use this loan to stock his business for the busy season ahead.  He tries, he says, to keep the business fully-stocked so that he won't lose customers.  When we asked him about his goals for the future, he told us, "At my age, I don't have any grand plans, but I would like to carry on the business so that my wife and I won't have to worry about supporting ourselves in the future".  Don Eusebio is grateful for our help because we have always supported his efforts to grow his business and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to stock his retail business.

location.town: San Agustin San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Ma. Visitacion

texts.en: Ma. Visitacion, 37 years old, is married and the owner of a store where she sells different products to the community. She is a very kind person and responsible to her family. Ma. Visitacion is asking for a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy additional products such as snack food, noodles, coffee and rice for her store. She hopes that her store will expand so that she can renovate it to be more convenient for her customers. In this way, she hopes to increase her income and to be able to sustain her family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase snack food, noodles, coffee and rice for her store.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en: Amelita, 54 years old, is married and lives in the Philippines. For the past 8 years, she has provided habal-habal or motorcycle services, with her husband as the driver. Amelita has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to pay for motorcycle maintenance. Amelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana es una persona muy alegre, siempre esta de muy bien humor su mama comenta que tiene el mismo carácter de su papa, Diana nos platica que tiene 28 años de edad está casada con el señor Rubén juntos han formado una familia con tres niños los cuales van a la escuela. Diana nos cuenta que tiene un negocio de molinos para moler nixtamal  (El nixtamal es el maíz ya cocido que se utiliza para hacer tortillas) donde tiene trabajadores donde ellos mismos los arman los moldean Diana nos platica “Yo inicie el negocio del molino porque un primo de mi marido trabajaba haciendo molinos pero lo despidieron, entonces a mi me surgió la idea   que si el ya sabía armarlos le propuse que yo ponía el dinero el local para iniciar el negocio de los molinos". Es por eso que ya desde hace siete años tienen este negocio. A Diana le gusta mucho ayudar en su negocio ya que e aprendió mucho desde que inicio; nunca imagino llegar a tener tanto éxito pero esto la hace muy feliz nos cuenta que no tiene ningún problema  ya que sale a vender a las comunidades pero también los clientes llegan  a su negocio y gracias a las buenas referencias que han dado de sus molinos.
La meta de Diana es que sus hijos terminen una carrera profesional ya que esta segura de que sus niños triunfaran como profesionales, porque comentan que son niños muy inteligentes, Diana está muy contenta y agradecida con la institución ya que con el crédito otorgado ella pudo invertir en sus  molinos y ha visto sus ganancias de inmediato.

*En la imagen: Diana en la tienda de abarrotes de sus padres.
texts.en:
Diana is a friendly woman, always in good humor.  Her mother says that she takes after her father.  Diana, 28, tells us that she and her husband, Ruben, have three school-aged children.  She operates a business milling nixtamal.  (Nixtamal is a cooked maize preparation that provides the base for tortillas.)  She says, "I got the idea for the business when my husband's cousin was laid off from the nixtamal mill where he used to work . . . I decided to put up the money so that we could start our own mill".  The business is seven-years old now.  Diana says that she likes the business and has learned a lot about it over the years.  She never imagined that it would be so successful, but she's very happy that it is.  She travels out to sell product from the mill but many come to her because her customers have referred them to her.  For the future, Diana wants her children to study for professional careers.  She says that her children are very smart and she is sure they will do very well if they have the chance to continue studying.  Diana is grateful to the institution because she has been able to invest past loans in growing her milling business.

*Diana is pictured in her parent's store.

loans.use: to improve her food processing business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 27-year-old married mom of an infant. She lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City. Grace has been sewing for 3 years, earning a monthly income of PHP 4,000, which is fair enough to cover day-to-day expenses.

Grace joined Gata Daku MPC in 2007. She has applied for a loan of PHP 4,500 from the cooperative to buy sewing materials such as textiles, thread, etc. By having all necessary materials, Grace hopes to create as much output as she can to earn more income. She is also planning to expand her business area and/or to buy another set of sewing machines.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as textiles, thread, etc.

loans.name: Venia

texts.en:
Venia is 39, is married and has three children. Her husband is a farm worker and has experience in managing his crops. The family lives in their own home in Cabisera 7, which is within the rural area of the municipality of Ilagan. They have electrical service to their residence.

For the past six years, Venia has raised and fattened pigs. She then slaughters them and sells them at the local market. Together, Venia and her husband are able to cover expenses.

Venia is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan from ASKI, which she will use to buy feed for the pigs and repair their sties, as well as repair her own home. She will be able to improve her family’s standard of living and satisfy more of their needs.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs and repair their sties.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is from Gango Rizal, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old and is married with 3 children. Nilda owns and operates a general store for a living. She has been engaged in her business for 23 years and earns 6,000PHP a month. 

In 2009, Nilda joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 12,000PHP which will be used to purchase new items such as candies, "Milo", shampoo and soaps. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to sell in her general store, such as candies, "Milo", shampoo and soaps.

loans.name: Ndiang Montagne Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe issu du Banc Villageois de Ndiang Montagne est créé depuis le 15 décembre 2008. Il est composé de cinq femmes très dynamiques qui habitent le même quartier et mènent comme activité principale le commerce.

Mame Touty la responsable est âgée de 57 ans, elle est mariée mère de trois enfants dont une fille, le plus jeune a 18 ans. Elle est couturière et a son atelier à domicile; elle confectionne des habits de femmes qu'elle revend.Elle est debout à droite sur la photo habillée en boubou noir a rayures dorées avec un châle blanc sur les épaules et a levé la main gauche.


Elle coud plus sur commande des ensembles brodés, voiles, bazin et autres..... Mame achète ses tissus, percale et accessoires à Dakar.


Elle envisage d'acheter pour un valeur de 500000 F de tissus pour ainsi se faire plus de revenus après vente.



Avec ses bénéfices, elle épargne, subvient à ses petits besoins et participe à la gestion des dépenses familiales. Son mari est à la retraite.
texts.en:
This group from the Ndiang Montagne Banc Villageois was created on December 15, 2008. It is made up of five active women who live in the same neighborhood and who all work in commerce.

Mame Touty, the group's representative, is 57 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is a girl, and the youngest of whom is 18 years old. She is a couturier, and she makes female clothing to sell. She works from home. In the photo, she is the woman standing on the right with her left hand raised, wearing a black boubou with gold stripes, and a white shawl draped over her shoulders.

She receives orders for embroidered sets, veils, damask, etc. She buys her fabric, percale, and accessories in Dakar.

She plans to buy 500,000 F of fabric, so that she can make more revenue once she sells it.

With the profits, she takes care of her needs, helps cover her family's expenses, and saves some too. Her husband is retired.

loans.use: to make clothing to sell

loans.name: J Jesús

texts.es: Don Jesús es una persona muy bromista siempre hace reír a cualquier persona que se le acerque siempre anda bromeando con todo mundo. Don Jesús una persona que tiene ya 55 años de edad está casado con la señora Marcelina quien es ama de casa. Don Jesús es un hombre que no tuvo muchas oportunidades de estudiar es por eso que desde muy temprana edad inicio a trabajar en un taller eléctrico en una ciudad pequeña cuando le preguntamos quien fue quien le enseñó las tareas de su actividad económica, bromeando nos contesto “Pues quien me enseño ya está 3 metros bajo tierra y era mi patrón” y en ese momento soltó una carcajada enorme. Después quiso iniciar su negocio en el municipio de San Felipe, ahora ya tiene 23 años con su refaccionaria y está muy contento trabajando comento “lo que más me gusta es hacer funcionar los carros de los clientes y ver cómo se van contentos con el servicio que les he dado y estoy seguro de que regresaran”. Esta vez Don Jesús ha solicitado un crédito para comprar refacciones para comprar y usar refacciones como unidades, reguladores, entre otras cosas su pedido normalmente lo hace 15 días antes, se le complica mucho comprar refacciones ya que están muy caros esta es una de las dificultades que presenta Don Jesús y así comenta que no puede crecer como él quisiera, pero una de sus metas es llegar a tener una refaccionaria mas grande y mejor acondicionada con todo el equipo que se requiere para hacer mejor su servicio. Don Jesús deja un mensaje “muchas gracias a las personas de KIVA y VisionFund por todo el apoyo que nos otorgan ya que gracias a los créditos que nos dan podemos levantar más rápido nuestros negocios”.
texts.en: Don Jesús, 55, is a friendly man, always willing to share a joke with anyone he meets.  He is married to Sra. Marcelina, a housewife.  Don Jesús never had a chance to go to school because he had to go to work when he was very young.  He worked at an electricals repair shop in a small city for a few years and when we asked him how he picked up the skills for it, he laughed loudly and said, "Well . . . the owner was my teacher, but he's 6 feet under now".  He started his own auto repair business 23 years ago, he says and adds, "What I most like about my business is fixing cars and knowing that my customers will be happy with my work and come back if and when they need additional work".  Don Jesús is applying for a loan to buy the spare parts he needs to operate his business.  He usually receives supplies of spare parts 15 days after he submits orders for them.  He hasn't been able to grow the business in the way that he'd like because his supplies are expensive and long lead times are often a problem.  For the future, he wants to expand and improve his shop so that he can provide an even better service.  Don Jesús wants you to know that he, "is very grateful to KIVA lenders and VisionFund for supporting small businesses over the years and helping me and others to help ourselves".

loans.use: to fund his vehicle repair business.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en: Adriana is married and has two children. She has been involved in a hog raising business for five years. Adriana has two pigs, one calf and three goats in her business. She makes a monthly profit of about PHP 5,000 from selling her animals. She intends to continue developing her animal husbandry business. In order to further grow her business, Adriana has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional livestock. She plans to invest her earnings from the loan into continued increase of livestock.

loans.use: To buy a pig for her business

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en: Ludivina, 49 years old, is married and lives in the Philippines. For the past 9 years, she has provided habal-habal or motorcycle services, with her husband as the driver. Ludivina has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to pay for motorcycle maintenance. Ludivina has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, she hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is 54 years old and lives in Prenza, Tangub City. She is married and has 3 children. For the past 31 years, Rosalinda has managed a gardening business, earning a monthly income of PHP 5,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. Rosalinda been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, she hopes to expand her garden land to sustain her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for repairs and maintenance for one of his business vehicles.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: Celia, 45, has three children and is married to Abner, who works as a government employee. Haydee, her eldest child, is currently living in Jordan and is a factory worker. Hayleen is a fourth-year college student. Absel, the youngest, is also in college. Sending them to college is very costly. Celia hopes that her children will finish their studies with her financial support. To help her husband in providing for the growing needs of their children, Celia began selling beauty soaps. She gets orders from people in her community and then purchases her products in Tumauini, Isabela. She also maintains a hog-raising business in their home. To further grow both of her businesses, Celia is requesting a loan for PHP 25,000 from Kiva lenders. She hopes to obtain a loan from lenders to have her business raise more capital. She plans to purchase stocks of beauty soaps and feed for her hogs to help them grow bigger. She hopes that her loan will be approved so that her businesses will remain stable.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs and beauty soaps for her business.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 48 years old, married to Ann and together they have three children.He is a dairy farmer and has been in the business for the past year.
This is his second business loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET by a credit officer. He will use the loan amount to purchase a dairy cow. He paid his previous loan well and in good time.

He hopes to own a motorcycle in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a  dairy  cow.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a resident of  Nyamira, where she has been farming for 20 years. She is married with two children, ages 12 and 7. Her main farming products are milk, vegetables, maize and sorghum. She runs a grocery retail business in the local market for additional income.

Anna has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. She says she will channel her farming income toward the education of her children as well as improving their general living standards.

Anna says poor weather conditions, especially the fluctuation of heavy rains with drought, make farming income inconsistent, calling for harvesting rain or setting up an irrigation system..

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy noodles, snacks and seasonings to prepare her food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is the mother of five children, all of school-going age. She has twelve years of experience in farming with tea being her main product until recently, when she ventured into dairy farming.

Veronicah says the loan will help her acquire a dairy cow. which will improve her family's income and ability to meet their basic needs. She says the challenge in farming remains lack of capital to do commercial farming. However, she is glad that Juhudi Kilimo loans will alleviate the problem among smallholder farmers.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Remegia

texts.en:
Remegia loves helping other people, especially her relatives. She is 57 and single. Her previous business was hog raising, but since she started her fish vending activity and direct selling business, she immediately stopped raising hogs.

Remegia has engaged in her direct selling business for three years. Though it is quite difficult to handle due to some credits and delayed payments, she patiently runs it. She has a lot of orders, but her capital is not enough, so she is asking for a loan of PHP20,000, which will be used to buy cosmetics such as lipstick, blush and makeup. Some will also be used to buy milk fish and tilapia for her vending activity. Through satisfying her customers demand, she will be able to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional cosmetic products, such as lipstick, blush, and makeup for her direct selling business

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  est créé  le 02 Décembre 2002  au jour de l’inauguration du banc villageois. Il est composé de 04  femmes très attachées au culte du travail, elles jouissent d’une très bonne expérience dans le système des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes issues du même Village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fatoumata  (assise à l’extrême droite en médaillons en bas) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée de 68 ans, est mariée et mère de 11 enfants (05 garçons et 06 filles) elle prend aussi en charge 08 de ses neveux. Elle est vendeuse détaillante de riz, lait en poudre, sucre et autres condiments. Cette activité elle l’a pratique depuis  plus de dix ans.

Avec ce prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en riz pour trois sacs à 14 000 FCFA trois bidons de vingt litre d’huile de palm à 10 000 FCFA le bidon transport payé à la charge  en raison de 250 FCFA par sac. Cette activité est renouvelée au tant de fois possible durant le mois.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’épargner  en partie  et  de soutenir son mari  en âge très avancée dans la prise en charge de la famille dans son ensemble.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 2, 2002, upon the inauguration of the local Banc Villageois. It consists of four women who are deeply devoted to the cult of work. They have extensive experience with the Banc Villageois system. They are all from the same village and their main activity is small trade. 

Mrs. Fatoumata (sitting at the far right and shown inset) is the featured borrower for the group. She is a 68-year-old married mother of eleven children, five boys and six girls. She also looks after eight of her nephews. She has been selling rice, powdered milk, sugar and other condiments for over 10 years.

She will use this loan to buy three bags of rice for 14,000F Cfa and three 20-liter jugs of palm oil at 10,000F Cfa each, with transportation to be paid by the load at a cost of 250F Cfa per bag. This process is usually repeated as many times as possible during the month.

The profits earned through this activity will allow her to bolster her savings and to help her elderly husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy rice, powdered milk and oil for resale.

loans.name: Karurama Group

texts.fr:
Rémy fait partie du groupe Karurama  et habite à  Cibitoke. Il a 39 ans et est marié à Elisabeth, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants, âgés de 1  à 14 ans, dont 2 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de  boutique (riz, haricot, huile de palme,...)  depuis  4 ans. 

Il est à son cinquième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (riz, haricot, huile de palme,...) à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Rémy is a member of the Karurama group and lives in Cibitoke. He is 39 years old and is married to Elisabeth, a farmer. Together they have four children, aged 1 to 14; two of which go to school.

Rémy has been running a shop ([selling] rice, beans, palm oil...) for 4 years. 

He is on his fifth loan with Turame. And with this Kiva-financed loan he's going to increase his capital and buy goods (rice, beans, palm oil,...) to resell for profit. 

In the next few years, he would like to buy a plot of land and see his children go to school.

loans.use: to buy goods for his shop (rice, beans, palm oil,...) to resell for profit

loans.name: El Maya Group

texts.es: Doña Manuela tiene 76 años de edad y pertenece al grupo llamado Maya dice que le pusieron ese nombre por que  donde se van a reunir la dueña de la casa vende esculturas de los mayas y para ponerle rápido nombre a su grupo decidieron ponerle ese aparte dice que es un nombre muy original ya que es una de las culturas mas importantes de México. Platica que  ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa para dama, caballeros y niños y dice que lo tiene desde hace mas de 20 años y dice que ella va a surtir su ropa a León Guanajuato donde le dan mejores precios y asi ella le gana un poco mas. Platica que vende su ropa en diferentes tianguis de comunidades aledañas a su población y eso la tiene muy contenta por que a su edad se siente útil y tiene su propio dinero. Dice que ella esta  pidiendo un crédito para la compra de calcetas escolares para niña, camisas y blusas escolares color blanca ya que ahorita acaban de entrar al nuevo ciclo escolar los niños  y sus clientas le han pedido eso, asi como también pantalones azules y blancos para niños y faldas de específicos colores para ocuparlos como uniformes en la escuelas. Dice que ella espera que con el crédito que le hagan pueda surtir mejor su negocio. Los otros cuatro integrantes del grupo se llaman Petra, Rosalba, María Elena y Eduardo ellos invertirán en sus negocios como en una taquería, en bordado de prendas artesanales, en compra de perfumes y ropa por catalogo y venderlos, en compra de cerdos y compra de alimento para estos.
texts.en:
Manuela is 76 years old and belongs to a group called Maya. She says that they chose this name because at the place where they meet, the owner of the house sells Mayan sculptures. In order to quickly choose a group name they decided on this one, and apart from that it's a very original name since it's one of the most important cultures of Mexico.

She tells us that she has a business selling clothing for women, men, and children and says that she's had it for more than 20 years. She says she goes to stock up on her clothing in León Guanajuato where they give her better prices and in this way she earns a little more. She tells us she sells her clothing at different marketplaces in her town's surrounding communities and she's very happy with this because at her age she feels useful and has her own money.

She says that she is requesting a loan to buy white stockings, shirts, and blouses for girls' school uniforms, since the new school year has just started and her customers are asking for these things, as well as blue and white trousers for boys, and skirts in specific colors to be used as school uniforms. She says that she hopes that with this loan they are giving her that she'll be able to better supply her business.

The other four members of the group are Petra, Rosalba, María Elena, and Eduardo. They will invest in their businesses such as a taco stall, embroidery of artisanal garments, buying perfume and clothing from catalogs and selling them, and buying pigs and pig feed.

loans.use: sell clothing for the whole family.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 35-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol, Philippines. She has four young children and has been in the fishing business for more than 15 years. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Elizabeth is a hard-working woman. She gives her best to provide support to her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of their children.

Elizabeth will be able to use the loan to buy a new fishing net, fuel, and for the repair of the fishing boat, so that her husband can enhance his daily catch.

In the future, Elizabeth wants to make their way of living a success. More importantly, she wants to send her children to school for a better education and a bright future.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net and fuel and to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Mme Aminata est membre du Banc villageois de Petit Kandé depuis le 30 décembre 2009. Elle a adhéré par le biais de sa soeur. Âgée de 35 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants (02 garçons et 03 filles) âgés entre 15 et 06 ans.
Cette dame est une commerçante expérimentée. Elle s'active dans la vente d'huile de palme, d'arachides et de haricots. avec ce prêt, elle va acheter en gros pour revendre en détail au petit marché de la localité. Elle renouvelle son activité (02) deux fois dans le mois.
Les bénéfices de son commerce lui permettront d'appuyer son mari en payant la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en: Aminata has been a member of the "banc villageois" of Petit Kandé since December 30, 2009. She joined the group through her sister. At 35 years old, she is married and the mother of five children (two boys and three girls) between the ages of six and 15 years old. Aminata is an experienced tradeswoman. She keeps herself busy selling palm oil, peanuts and beans. With this loan, she will be able to purchase her supplies in bulk to resell at retail in her local market. She conducts her business in the market twice each month. With the income she earns from her sales, Aminata will be able to aid her husband in paying their children's schooling.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, peanuts and beans to resell at retail.

loans.name: Niyongabo Group

texts.fr:
Léa fait partie du groupe  Niyongabo et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 29 ans et est mariée à  Norbert, commerçant de viande. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants, âgées de 6 à 12 ans.


Elle fait le commerce de restaurant (riz, haricot, huile de palme,...) depuis  10 ans. 


Elle est à son sixième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de  produits vivriers( riz, haricot, huile de palme,...) à revendre cuits, dans son restaurant.
texts.en:
Léa is a member of the Niyongabo group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 29 years old and is married to Norbert, who sells meats. Together they have 3 children, aged 6 to 12 years old. 

Léa has been in the restaurant business ([selling] rice, beans, palm oil...) for ten years. 

This is her sixth loan with Turame. With this Kiva financed loan, she is going to increase her capital and buy a large amount of staple foods (rice, beans, palm oil,...) to cook and resell in her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of staple foods to be prepared and sold in her restaurant

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: El Sr. Manuel de 40 años de edad es casado y tiene 2 dependientes económicos, el es un hombre trabajador que se ha esforzado para salir adelante cuenta con un trabajo fijo y aparte se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos. Sabe que tiene que solventar económicamente a su familia, porque quiere que sus hijos no tengan carencia alguna es por eso que con gran esfuerzo ha ido poco a poco dándose a conocer para que su negocio crezca. En esta ocasión Manuel solicita de nuestra ayuda para pagar las placas del vehiculo que utiliza para transportar la mercancía de su negocio. Manuel agradecerá la ayuda que se brinde.
texts.en: Manuel is 40 years old, married and has two dependents.  He is a hardworking man who has made an effort to get ahead.  He has a steady job and also sells clothing and shoes.  He knows that he has to provide for his family, because he wants his children not to lack anything.  It’s for this reason that he has been working to grow his business little by little.  At this time Manuel is asking for our help so that he can pay for the registration of his vehicle, which he uses to transport merchandise to his business.  Manuel appreciates the help he receives.

loans.use: to pay vehicle registration expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle, which he uses to transport people.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Editha has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Editha  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Editha hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
